She has restarted her general store business and is now requesting a PHP 9942 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. With your help Ma. Shirley will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Ma. Shirley would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and earns more income from fishing.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed seedlings for her business.

Catalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seedlings for her business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school. 

Marites and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Marites is taking a housing loan of PHP 9,800 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Marites has been with NWTF as a borrower since 2013.  She plans to recover through her fishing business.

With your help, Marites can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Tièssiri est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Sogomougou de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Savon, fruit et légumes et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de groupe. 
Mawa est un membre du groupe Tièssiri assise deuxième personne de droite à gauche, vendeuse de savons.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de savons au marché en quantité et en qualité qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure de ces savons à Koutiala. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Tièssiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Mawa  compte réaliser  120 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Tièssiri is a group made up of women from the Sogomougou neighborhood in Koutiala. They know each other well and all live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. The women are on average 36 years old, married, and have at least five children. This group of women works to sell various goods such as soap, fruit and vegetables, and so on. To increase their business, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. The group is now on their ninth loan.

Mawa, who is seated second from the right, sells soap. She plans to use her loan to buy high quality soap at wholesale and then sell it at retail to a mixed group of customers. While the other members of the group hope to earn an average monthly profit of 115,000 francs CFA, Mawa hopes to earn 120,000 francs CFA. 

In addition to paying back the loan, the women will use a part of their earnings to support their personal needs and a part to increase their cash flow.

The group members wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwsao so that their stocks are never depleted.

loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 41 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Paglaum Dumalinao ZDS.
 
Arlyn has a store that sells goods and dry goods, and has been in this business for eight years. She also has rice fields for her additional income. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy goods for her store.
 
Arlyn has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future she hopes to build big stall in her town.

loans.use: to buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Ciony

texts.en:
Ciony is 42 years old and is married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a business buying and selling shells in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.  

Ciony requested a loan of PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy more shells to sell.

In the future, Ciony would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 32 años de edad, observando que hacían falta servicios de internet en su comunidad decidió dar inicio a su negocio., en el año 2005. Poco a poco incluyó el servicio de recargas y de telefonía celular,  vendiendo de contado  de lunes a domingos  desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la 9 de la noche vendiendo a clientes del sector donde está ubicado. Su meta de negocio es dar apertura a otros puntos de venta en barrios vecinos y a nivel familiar brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, aunque su mayor desafío sea, lograr tener capital de trabajo, para invertir y ganar mas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva mediante el cual comprará recargas pues ha crecido su demanda y también hará reparaciones locativas a su negocio, para tener una imagen empresarial de mas calidad y potencializar la venta en su mercado.
texts.en:
Juan, 32 years old, saw that his community had a need for internet services and, in the year 2005, decided to start his business. Little by little he included the service of phone credits and cell phones, selling for cash from Monday-Sunday from eight in the morning until nine at night, to clients in the area where he is located. 

His business goal is to open other points of sale in nearby neighborhoods, and his goal at the family level is to offer his children better quality of life. However, his greatest challenge will be to get working capital, in order to invest and make more money.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, with which he will buy phone credits, as demand has grown. He will also make some repairs to his place of business, so as to have a higher quality business image and increase potential sales.

loans.use: to buy phone credits, as demand has increased, and to make repairs to his place of business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 31 years old and is married with three children, who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Mary Ann has restarted her fishing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 9,714 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Mary Ann is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
Medelyn is 25 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Medelyn and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,800 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Medelyn has been with NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her fishing business.

With your help, Medelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ankabenkelekan 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Ankabenkelekan 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est   le riz avec Karia, 2 ème debout de  la gauche  vers  la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The ten members of the Ankabenkelekan 7 Group are married women with an average age of 46 and an average of five children each. They all live within traditional family frameworks in Fonfona, one of the villages of Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This is their ninth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, with whom their previous loans were paid back in full. The group's main produce is rice. The group's representative is Karia, the woman standing second from the left in the back row in the photo. With this loan, she is planning on purchasing farming inputs, seeds and agricultural materials, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold on a village level as well as at market to a customer base made up of both men and woman. She is planning on making an average profit of 90,000 FCFA by the end of the season. These profits will allow her to pay off the loan. They will also allow her to aide her husband with their family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, seeds, farming inputs and agricultural materials

loans.name: Tulio Mario

texts.es: Buscando acreditar favorablemente su negocio el señor tulio requiere un préstamo para realizar algunas implementaciones en su tienda de productos de la canasta familiar como lo son pintura y ciertas reformas locativas para hacer de su local un espacio más agradable y ambientado para los clientes, también quiere invertir en surtido mejorando su inventario, atrayendo nuevos clientes que recurren a grandes almeces para conseguir productos que no consiguen en una tienda general, este crédito para Tulio será de gran transcendencia pues la fuerte competencia le ha disminuido las ventas y este local es el único medio e ingreso y de sostenimiento de su familia conformado por su esposa y dos niños menores de edad
texts.en: Seeking to improve his business, Tulio needs a loan to make some improvements in his staple products store. He wants to paint it and make some improvements to make his locale a more pleasing space for his customers. He also wants to invest in improving his inventory so he can attract new customers who go to the big stores to get products that they can't get in a general store. This loan for Julio is very important because strong competition has diminished his sales and the store is his only source of income and support for his family, made up of his wife and two minor children.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve his inventory and what he offers his customers. He will also make some improvements to make his store more a more pleasing space for the users.

loans.name: Viviana Maria

texts.es:
Viviana, de 35 años, vive en el municipio de El Retiro y desde allí se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada como ropa y accesorios por catalogo donde sus principales clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos.
Ella es una mujer muy dedicada y juiciosa y siempre está disponible para lo que necesiten sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran almacén en el cual pueda vender gran cantidad de productos de variada categoría.
El crédito lo utilizara en la compra de mercancía como ropa de hombre y dama para aumentar su inventario y mejorar así sus ventas.
Es una madre muy amorosa y siempre está buscando la forma de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Viviana is 35 years old. She lives in the town of El Retiro and there she works selling varied merchandise such as clothes and accessories via catalogue. Her main customers are relatives, friends and neighbors. 

She is a very dedicated and judicious woman and she is always available for what her customers need.  Her biggest dream is to be able to have a big store where she can sell a lot of different products. She will use the loan to buy merchandise, such as men's and women's clothing, to increase her inventory and improve her sales. She is a loving mother and always looking for a way to offer her two small children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jorge Humberto

texts.es:
Desde hace 6 meses el joven Jorge decidió independizarse y comenzar a trabajar en su propio vivero, pues considera que de esta forma obtiene más y mejores ingresos para su familia.
El actualmente vive con sus padres y siempre trata de colaborarle en lo que más puede.
El solicita un préstamo para construir un invernadero y surtido de plantasy flores de diferentes especies, esta planta las conseguirá en las fincas cercanas para iniciar.
Ya que es un hombre inquieto e inteligente, seguramente alcanzara sus metas y tendrá el invernadero más grande y reconocido de toda la zona.
Su mayor dificultad es la falta de dinero para invertir.
texts.en:
Six months ago, Jorge decided to go off on his own and start working in his own greenhouse because he this way he will make more income for his family.  Right now, he lives with his parents and he always tries to help them any way he can. He is asking for the loan to build a greenhouse and buy inventory of different species of plants and flowers. He will obtain the plants from nearby farms to start with. 

Since he is an active and intelligent man, for certain he will attain his goals and have the biggest and best known greenhouse in the whole area. His biggest difficulty is the lack of money to get started.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and to buy a variety of plants and flowers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothing for children, men and women, which will be resold

loans.name: Gladis Del Rosario

texts.es: Gladis es una señora de 41 años de edad, ella es una señora colombiana  que vive 12 años en Ecuador, dice que se vino con su familia a este pais en busca de trabajo y de una vida tranquila, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para sacar edelante a sus 2 hijos que asisten al colegio y a su hija de 20 años que tiene un bebe, Gladis aspira mejorar su negocio y sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su nieta.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 41 year old lady; she is Colombian and has lived in Ecuador for 12 years. She says she came to this country with her family in search of work and of a peaceful life.

She will use the loan to buy a cow to help her 2 sons who are in school and her 20 year old daughter who has a baby. Gladis hopes to improve her business and help her children and granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Djiguitougou est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koko de la ville de Koury qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Condiments, Beignet et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. 
Sanata est un membre du groupe Djiguitougou assise et au milieu, vendeuse de condiments (Oignon, pattes d’arachide, piment…).  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter au fur et à mesure ces condiments au marché en quantité et en qualité qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguitougou comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 130 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Sanata compte réaliser  145 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Djiguitougou Group brings together women from the Koko district of the town of Koury. They all know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. These married women have an average age of 37 and and at least two children each. This group of women sell various items, such as everyday food items and fritters. In order to expand the scale of their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso lending scheme. This will be their fifth group loan.

Sanata, the woman sat in the middle of the front row in the photo, is a member of the Djiguitougou Group. She sells everyday food items, such as onions, peanut paste and chilli. She plans on using this loan to purchase good quality products in large quantities, as and when she needs them, at the local market. She will then resell them to a mixed customer base. Whereas other members of the Djiguitougou Group are each planning to make an average profit of 130,000 FCFA over the course of this loan cycle, Sanata is planning on making 145,000 FCFA. In addition to paying back the loan, they will use part of the revenue to pay for their daily expenses and increase their working capital. They hope to further develop this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that their stock levels remain strong.

loans.use: to purchase everyday food items

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre casado de 26 años de edad sin hijos
Él es poblador de Karhuiza, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía, el clima del lugar es bastante inhóspito afecta de gran manera las siembras y la crianza de ganado, sin embargo los productores trabajan mucho para contrarrestar las dificultades climáticas de la zona.
Edwin posee estudios secundarios completos y también cumplió con su servicio militar, es ahí donde recibió educación técnica sobre la crianza de ganado y gracias a eso ahora piensa en mejorar sus ingresos.
Recientemente Edwin se casó y ahora cuenta con nuevos sueños y metas tales como mejorar su producción de quesos, en eso le colabora su esposa que lo acompaña siempre a todo lugar.
Ambos esposos se ocupan de su microempresa en crecimiento y dán todo de sí para que el negocio prospere, ellos sueñan con mejorar su calidad de vida para poder tener familia y saben que para traer niños al mundo deben mejorar sus ingresos.
Es por esos motivos que Edwin solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno productor lechero.
texts.en:
Edwin is a married 26-year-old man without children.

He lives in Karhuiza, a community that works in agriculture, animal husbandry, and handicrafts; the rather inhospitable climate of this place has a profound effect on the crops and the raising of cattle. However, the farmers work hard to counteract the climatic difficulties of the region.

Edwin completed secoondary school and also completed his military service and that is where he got his technical education about raising livestock and, thanks to this, he is now thinking of increasing his income. 

Edwin recently got married and now has new dreams and goals such as increasing his cheese production; his wife works with him in this and always accompanies him everywhere. 

Both take care of the growing small business and give it their all so that the business prospers. They dream of a better quality of life to be able to have a family and know that to bring children into the world, they must increase their income. 

It is for this reason that Edwin asks for a loan to purchase dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Monic Angellah

texts.en:
Angellah is a 48-year-old woman and a well-respected leader in her community. When she was a child, her parents got divorced and lived separately from each other. Her father had another three wives and nineteen children in total. Together with her mother, he has seven children.

Angellah lived with her mother and her six brothers and sisters, while her father paid the school fees. But her elder sister got pregnant when she was in her first year of secondary. Thus, their father decided that he would not pay school fees for girls any longer. 

Fortunately, one of Angellah's brothers already worked; he had a shop. He decided to take care of Angellah and paid her school fees so that she continued going to school. When Angellah was in her third year of secondary, Angellah's brother got robbed, so he lost everything and had no more money to pay for Angellah's school fees. Angellah had to leave school when she was 16 and then decided that the best solution would be to marry.

Now, Angellah is working as a storekeeper, while her husband is a butcher. She is a mother of five kids between the ages of 19 and 30. The youngest two, aged 19 and 21, still live at home and still go to school. As Angellah did not have the chance to study, her priority is to ensure that her kids have the possibility to study.
 
In order to pay for the school fees, Angellah is also working as a micro-entrepreneur, selling energy-efficient cooking stoves that also generate electricity while cooking. In Uganda, most people do not have access to electricity and use three-stone fires for cooking, which are extremely unhealthy and cause deforestation, as they are inefficient and thus a lot of firewood is needed. Most people in Uganda are very poor and earn little money on a daily/weekly basis; they do not have savings. 

Angellah's customers, mainly women from her area, cannot afford the clean-cooking stove she is selling, and also Angellah cannot pay UpEnergy to purchase the energy-efficient cooking stoves. The Kiva loan enables Angellah to purchase the stoves and to offer them to her community with installment payments. Thus, these women are able to purchase the energy-efficient cooking stove and benefit from it, while they pay for it in three monthly installments. 

The benefit of working with UpEnergy for Angellah is that she can support her family (pay for school fees) and help the women in her community (by enabling them to own a clean, energy-efficient cooking stove). But her favorite part of working for UpEnergy remains the ability to pay her children's school fees.

For Angellah, the biggest benefit of the energy-efficient stoves is that by using these stoves, people save a lot of money on firewood, as they need less fuel; also, people use firewood instead of more expensive (and more harmful) charcoal. Furthermore, there is almost no smoke at all when using the energy-efficient cooking stove. The other huge benefit is that people can use a light with the stove and even charge their phones. Light enables, for example, studying after dark. 

By selling UpEnergy's products, Angellah observed that the people in her community have fewer expenses (by saving 50% and more on fuel costs) and that the children cough much less then before (as there is almost no more smoke due to cooking). 

Angellah's hopes and dreams for the future are that she will be a healthy woman and that the poor women in her community will be able to leave poverty and will be able to pay school fees for their kids. 

Another dream is that one day she will sleep in a good house with walls made from cement, and with electricity. Step by step she is renovating her house by rebuilding the walls, which were originally made of mud and sticks, using bricks, and one day hopefully, even concrete.

loans.use: to pay for clean energy-efficient cooking stoves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mill motor

loans.name: Sicela Nancy

texts.es:
Sicela es una persona emprendedora, tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en Sayan junto a su familia.
Al ser madre soltera tuvo que buscar la manera de salir adelante sola para poder brindarle lo mejor a su hijo.
Desde hace 5 años trabaja en un Servicentro como encargada y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable, trabajadora, honesta y muy respetuosa.
Sicela está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería (gaseosas) para iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de gaseosas y así pueda tener un ingreso adicional que podrá ahorrar para poder realizar su gran sueño: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Sicela is an enterprising person. She is 25 years old, a single mother, and lives in Sayan with her family.

When she became a single mother, she had to look for a way to get ahead and to offer the best to her child.

For the past 5 years, she has worked in a service center as a manager and it is going very well for her since she is a responsible, hard-working, honest and very respectful person. 

Sicela is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have offered her, she will purchase merchandise (soft drinks) to open a small business selling soft drinks, and in this way be able to have additional income that she will be able to save in order to realize her big dream: have her own business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (soft drinks) to start a small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies like thread, elastic and zippers to meet part of the demand of his customers and to meet his budget to start his own line of jeans.

loans.name: Marina Del Sociorro

texts.es: Marina de 49 años de edad habita al sur de la ciudad donde vende mercancia variada como ropa calzado y bolsos desde hace dos años. Su negocio nació motivado por una amiga quien la impulso para que lograra vender articulos mediante guias especializadas de productos. Marina comenzó con su familia, sus vecinos y amigos hasta que logró llegar a una clientela menos doméstica, como hasta la presente. Toso esto ha sido fortalecido porque trabaja en oficios varios en una oficina y allí tambien tiene clientes. Sus ventas son usualmente a crédito y trabaja todas las noches despues de llegar de la oficina. . Sus compras las hace de contado en almacenes donde le ofrecen mejores precios y mediante guias especializadas que ofrecen empresas y a las cuales se encuentra afiliada. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará jeans, sueteres, femeninos masculinos e infantil, además de calzado en estas mismas líneas. Con esta inversión espera tener mas ventas y un número mayor de clientes,haciendo así que su inversión sea exitosa.
texts.en: Marina, 49 years old, lives in the south of the city, where she has sold a variety of merchandise such as clothing, footwear, and handbags for the last two years. Her business began with motivation by a friend who pushed her so that she would sell clothing through specialized product catalogs.  Marina started with her family, her neighbors and friends, until she managed to have a less domestic customer base, such as she has at the present. All of this has been strengthened because she does various jobs in an office and there she has customers. Her sales are usually on credit and she works every night after getting home from the office. Her makes her purchase in cash in warehouses where they offer better prices and through specialized catalogs that businesses offer and with which she is affiliated.  At the moment she is asking for a Kiva loan, which is the first loan that she has gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase jeans, women's, mens's and children's sweaters, in addition to footwear in the same lines.  With this investment, she hopes to have more sales and a larger number of customers, in this way making the investment successful.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothing and footwear

loans.name: Lucia Eusebia

texts.es:
Lucía es una mujer de 41 años de edad casada y madre de 3 hijos.
Su residencia se encuentra en Isla Suriqui, junto a su esposo hacen los esfuerzos para que sus 3 hijos puedan asistir a la escuela, su esposo es pescador que lleva décadas en esa labor mientras que ella hace 5 años comenzó un emprendimiento propio y dejó la agricultura de lado.
Lucía se encarga de atender una tienda de barrio, para realizar esa labor se levanta muy temprano por la madrugada y viaja en bote hasta el puerto, continua viajando en bus hasta la comunidad de batallas donde se encuentra su negocio, una vez en el lugar espera que llegue el pan diario porque es el primer alimento en ser solicitado por sus clientes. Abre las puertas y saca los toldos (sombrillas) para que los rayos solares no afecten los alimentos porque el sol llega de una manera muy fuerte al lugar, seguidamente llena un balde con agua y lo esparce en las afueras para que elimine el polvo, más tarde se prepara una taza de sultana caliente (cáscara de café hervido) y lo bebe para entrar en calor porque la temperatura ambiente es muy baja (4°C) a esa hora.
Para abastecer su tienda Lucía debe hacer otro viaje a la ciudad de ‘El Alto’ dónde consigue casi toda su mercadería a ser vendida, eso lo realiza los días domingos cuando sus hijos no estudian y se hacen cargo de la tienda, su marido no puede ayudarle porque se ocupa de la pesca diaria.
Lucía sueña con mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, ella no cuenta con capital económico para la compra de mercadería y tener su tienda bien abastecida.
Es por esos motivos que Lucía solicita un préstamo para la compra de refrescos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Lucía is a 41-year-old woman, married, and mother to three children.

Her home is found on Suriqui Island; along with her husband, they put forth the effort so that their three children can go to school.  Her husband is a fisherman who has done this work for decades, while 5 years ago she began her own business venture and stopped working in agriculture.

Lucía is responsible for a neighborhood store. To do this work, she gets up very early in the morning and goes by boat to the port, she continues travelling by bus to the the community of Batallas where her business is located. Once there, she waits until the daily bread arrives because it is the first food requested by her customers.  She opens the doors and gets out the awnings so the sun's rays don't affect the food because the sun is very strong in that place. Then she fills a bucket with water and sprinkles it outside to get rid of the dust. Later she prepares a hot cup of "sultana" (boiled coffee skins) and she drinks it to warm up because the ambient temperature is very low (4°C) at this time of day.

To stock her store, Lucía needs to go on another journey to the city of El Alto where she gets almost all of the merchandise to be sold. She does this on Sundays when her children aren't in school and they take care of the store. Her husband can't help her because he takes care of the daily fishing.

Lucía dreams of increasing her income to improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She doesn't have the economic capital to purchase the merchandise and keep the store well-stocked. For these reasons, Lucía asks for a loan to purchase soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Martha Belen

texts.es:
La señora Martha se gana la vida con la fabricación de artesanías y la venta de dulces artesanales en el municipio de El Peñol.
Trabaja todos los días con el afán de poder obtener los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Su principal desafío en este trabajo es las temporadas en las que la afluencia de turistas es muy baja, esto hace que sus ventas disminuyan.
Ella aspira a un auxilio económico para la compra de una estantería y materiales trabajo que le permitan mejorar la presentación de sus productos.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un almacén grande donde pueda exhibir y vender sus creaciones, teniendo así unos ingresos más estables.
q
texts.en:
Martha earns a living from making handicrafts and selling handmade sweets in the El Peñol municipality.

She works everyday with the ambition to be able to make the required income to sustain her family.

Her main challenge in her work is the seasons in which the number of tourists is very low, which means her sales diminish.

She is asking for economic support to buy a stall and working materials which will allow her to improve the presentation of her products.

Her greatest dream is to have a large shop where she can exhibit and sell her creations, and in so doing give her a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy a stall and working materials.

loans.name: Mamelon Group

texts.fr:
Mamelon est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Millionkin de la ville de Koury qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, des Habits, fruits et légumes, Céréales et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe. 
Adiata  est un membre du groupe Mamelon accroupie au bout et à droite, vendeuse de céréales (mil, sorghos, maïs,riz et fonio).  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de sacs de chacune de ces céréales au marché en quantité et en qualité qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Mamelon comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Adiata  compte réaliser  100 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Mamelon Group brings together women from the Millionkin district of the town of Koury. They all know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and in-laws. These married women have an average age of 32 and and at least three children each. This group of women sells various items, such as clothing, fruits, vegetables and cereals. In order to expand the scale of their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso lending scheme. This will be their third group loan.

Adiata, the woman crouching down on the right-hand side of the front row in the photo, is a member of the Mamelon Group. She sells cereals, such as millet, sorghum, corn, rice and fonio. She plans on using this loan to purchase each these cereals by the sackful, as and when she needs them, at market. She will then resell them to a mixed customer base. 

Whereas other members of the Mamelon Group are each planning to make an average profit of 95,000 FCFA over the course of this loan cycle, Adiata is planning on making 100,000 FCFA. In addition to paying back the loan, they will use part of the revenue to pay for their daily expenses and increase their working capital. They hope to further develop this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that their stock levels remain strong.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Marian Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda es una hermosa y morena mujer de 18 años edad que con sueños, entusiasmo y muchas ganas comenzó su negocio de heladería ayudada por sus padres quienes le compraron el local comercial y se lo entregaron para su administración buscando que ella misma se financie sus estudios y busque sus medios de sostenimiento pues ya es mayor de edad y debe convertirse en una persona productiva y como ya es la nueva administradora quiere solicitar su primer crédito para la compra de recipientes, utensilios, copas y ampliar la oferta de helados y preparaciones, su gran aspiraciones es consolidar su heladería y demostrar que la juventud solo es símbolo de ganas y entusiasmo para salir adelante y progresar en la vida
texts.en: Fernanda is a pretty, brown-haired, 18-year-old woman who, with her dreams, enthusiasm and great desire, began her ice cream shop business helped by her parents who bought her the retail space and gave it to her to run, intending that she finance her own studies and means of sustenance since she is an adult and should become a productive person.  Since she is the new manager she wants to ask for her first loan to purchase containers, utensils, and cups, and to expand her offerings of ice creams and preparations. Her great aspiration is to strengthen her ice cream shop and show that youth is only a symbol of desires and enthusiasm to get ahead and progress in life.

loans.use: to purchase containers, utensils, and cups and expand her offering of ice creams and preparations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a stove to start a business selling pastries.

loans.name: Severo

texts.es:
Severo es un hombre de 45 años de edad casado y padre de 4 hijos
Su vida la comparte con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, toda la familia se dedica a la ganadería vacuna, la esposa elabora quesos y derivados lácteos, los hijos se reparten tareas como el cuidado, la alimentación y transporte del ganado.
Los hijos estudian en la escuela secundaria y los 2 hijos mayores ya la terminaron, continuar con estudios superiores es difícil por las distancias, ellos radican en la población de Jancko Amay distante a más de 3 horas de la ciudad más cercana; “El cuidado del ganado se hace más fácil porque mis hijos se encargan de ello” comenta Severo.
Severo se encarga del comercio vacuno, compra ganado, lo cuida, lo pone en condiciones atractivas para que sus compradores elijan cuál les conviene y se los vende.
Él viaja bastante buscando compradores de otras comunidades y también preguntando que necesitan para poder satisfacer sus necesidades, pero no es el único en su campo existen otros comerciantes que le hacen la competencia. Su sueño consiste en dejar para sus hijos un negocio próspero y rentable pensado en eso en estos momentos necesita hacer la compra de ganado para la cría y venta, pero no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para hacerlo.
Es por ese motivo que Severo solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado por mayor.
texts.en:
Severo is a 45-year-old man, married, and father to 4 children.

He shares his live with his wife and his four children; the whole family works raising cattle. His wife makes cheeses and dairy products, the children share tasks such as caring for, feeding and transporting the cattle. 

The children are secondary school students and the two older ones have finished it. Continuing their higher education is difficult because of the distances. They reside in the town of Jancko Amay, more than 3 hours distant from the nearest city. "The care of the cattle is made easier because my children take responsibility for it," said Severo.

Severo is responsible for the sale and purchase of cattle, their care, making their condition attractive so that the the buyers pick which ones they like and he sells the cattle.  

He travels quite a lot looking for buyers in other communities and also asking what they need in order to be able to satisfy their needs, but he is not the only one in his field. There are other sellers who are his competition.  His dream is to leave his children a prosperous and profitable business.  Thinking of this, he now needs to purchase cattle to raise and sell them, but he doesn't have enough money to do it.

For this reason, Severo asks for a loan to purchase cattle wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase cattle wholesale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 26 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mercy's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fishing business and is committed to regain what she lost. Mercy is taking out a PHP 9,714 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Mercy has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. 

In the future, Mercy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 34 years old and has five children.  She is married and has five children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional rice seed and fertilizer and to pay for laborers' salaries.

Merlyn has been in the business for 16 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.                                                                           In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice seed and fertilizer and to pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 55 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013.  She has restarted her fishing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Mely is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 38 years old and has five children.  She is married and has five children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Nelia has been  doing this for seven years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Claudia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Claudia de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º grado, esta acompañada, su compañero de vida trabaja como electricista, son padres de 3 hijos que estudian.

Claudia tiene una tienda y comedor. Con el comedor lleva tres años, esta idea surgió ya que en el lugar no existía un comedor, en el cual ya tiene una empleada.

El crédito sera utilizado en la compra de una cocina térmica, mesas, y comprara mercadería para la tienda.

Esta muy contenta por el crédito, ya que por medio de este podrá mejorar la variedad de menú, mejorar la tienda, mejorar su calidad de vida. Su sueño a futuro es que su negocio sea estable y que vaya en crecimiento.
texts.en: Claudia is 33 years old. She studied up to 6th grade and has a domestic partner. He works as an electrician. They have 3 children, who are students. Claudia has a store and a diner. She has had this diner for three years. She had the idea to open it because there was no other diner in town, and she already has an employee. She will use the loan to buy a thermal stove, tables and merchandise for the store. She is very happy for the loan because thanks to it she will be able to improve the variety in the menu, improve the store and improve her quality of life. Her dream for the future is that her business is stable and that it keeps growing.

loans.use: to buy a thermal stove, tables, and merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 47 years old and married with seven children.  With six children in school, Joyce works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for three years. 

In the future Joyce would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 55 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013.  She has restarted her  business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 9485.70 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to  purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Merlinda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ma. Edna

texts.en:
Ma. Edna works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fishing business and is now requesting a PHP 4,971 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Ma. Edna will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Ma. Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Yhon Jairo

texts.es:
El señor Yhon ha trabajado toda su vida en el campo y tiene gran experiencia en el maneo de cultivos y animales. Estas habilidades las aprendió al lado de su padre quien fue agricultor toda su vida.
Hoy en día Yhon realiza trabajos de cosecha en diferentes fincas, además tiene un pequeño cultivo de papa y frijol en un terreno arrendado.
El sueña con poder tener algún día su propia parcela y realizar allí los cultivos de alimentos que trabaja.
Por ahora lo único que puede hacer es trabajar fuertemente en el cultivo que actualmente tiene y procurar por cosechar productos de calidad.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y semillas que le permitan tener unos cultivos mucho más sanos y productivos.
texts.en:
Yhon has worked his whole life in the countryside and has a lot of experience in the management of crops and animals.  He learned these skills at his father's side, who was a farmer his entire life.

These days, Yhon does harvest work in different farms, in addition to having a small crop of potatoes and beans on rented land.

His dream is to be able some day to have his own plot of land and there realize the cultivation of the foods he now works.

For now, the only thing that he can do is to work hard with the crops he currently has and ensure a harvest of quality products.

He asks for a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds that permit him to have much healthier and productive crops.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, 49, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has one school child and one married child. 

To make a living, she works as a farmer is small rice field that is located just behind her house.  It is more than ten years that she has been involved in this farming business, which can earn net profits of USD 5 per day.

Chan wants to improve her family income by buying baby pigs to raise and sell when they get older. Now she is borrowing a loan from HKL to buy baby pigs to raise and sell. Chan would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy baby pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hardworking mother from Oroquieta. At 61, she never gets tired of providing for her family. 

She carefully managed her store with the small capital she got from Paglaum MPC. She was able to roll her earnings into the business and now it has progressed so that she thinks it is time for expansion. 

She applied a loan of PHP 8,000 to restock the store with basic commodities. Pacita hopes to have a comfortable living with her family around.

loans.use: To restock store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario has been operating his own retail store for more than four years and he earns well from this. He works hard with his business in order to make a living. 

To improve sales, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, Mario hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida works hard to support her family. Vida is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Vida has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Jorry

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jorry works hard to support his family.

He has a business manufacturing furniture in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Jorry is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials needed for his furniture manufacturing business.

He successfully paid back his previous loan, and now he has requested an additional loan to further build his business.

Jorry has been sustaining his business activities through the past 13 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream of saving money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed for his furniture

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 22 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013.  She has restarted her fishing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marlyn has taken a PHP 9714.3 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 55 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc., to sell.  She has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from a coffee shop.

Marjorie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her certificate for her degree in statistics.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol, 47, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five unmarried children and five married children.

To make a living, she works as a  farmer in a very small rice field that is located near her house. It is more than ten years that she has been involved in this farming business, which can earn a net profit of USD 4 per day.

Because her farm land is so small, it does not provide much income. For more profit, Thol wants to rent one more plot of farm land to operate her farming business. Now she is borrowing a loan from HKL to pay the farm land rental fee. She would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to pay the farm land rental fee.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara es una mujer de 41 años de edad casada y madre de 2 hijos
Ella terminó sus estudios secundarios y accedió a aprender corte y confección a nivel técnico, actualmente se dedica a la confección de polleras para cholitas y también para danzas folclóricas como; waca waca, chutas y morenada. Las cholitas son mujeres que usan un estilo de vestimenta tradicional y que se adquiere de generación en generación.
Su esposo se dedica al comercio, la colabora en la venta de las prendas y en la costura también.Sus hijos estudian en la escuela primaria y a pesar de que sus padres siguen las tradiciones y costumbres de sus ancestros ellos parecen dejarla de lado y dedicarse a las tradiciones de la televisión.
Genara es una persona activa y siempre vestida a la moda aunque su vestimenta sea tradicional los diseños colores y materiales son vanguardistas.
Genara tiene metas, sueños y preocupaciones; entre sus metas está en vencer a la competencia logrando mejores diseños y atendiendo más clientes, sus sueños se resumen en tener una tienda donde pueda exhibir los diseños al público y sus preocupaciones son la creciente competencia.
Ella necesita incrementar su producción para eso tiene que comprar; telas, hilos y material de confección.
Es por ese motivo que Genara solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de corte y confección de polleras.
texts.en:
Genara is a 41-year-old woman, married, and mother to 2 children.

She finished her secondary education and then learned dressmaking at a technical level. Currently, she works making polleras (traditional Bolivian skirts) for cholitas and also for the folkloric dances such as waca waca, chutas and morenada. Cholitas are women who use the traditional style of dress  which they acquire from generation to generation.

Her husband works in the business; he works with her in the clothing sales and in sewing as well. Her children are students in primary school and despite their parents following the traditions and customs of their ancestors, they seem to be leaving them behind and following the traditions of the television.

Genara is an active person and always is dressed fashionably.  Although her style of clothing is traditional, the design, colors and materials are trend-setting.

Genara has goals, dreams and concerns; among her goals are to beat the competition with better designs and by serving more customers, her dreams can be summarized as having a store where she can show her designs to the public and her worries are the growing competition.

She needs to increase her production and for this she needs to purchase fabric, thread, and production material. For this reason, Genara asks for a loan to purchase the material for making polleras.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make polleras (Bolivian skirts).

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 55 years old from Oroquieta. She gathered her courage to raise her family on her own. 

To earn a living, she runs a store that sells a variety of items. As a microfinance member, she took several loans and was able to repay in a timely manner. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to restock her store with canned goods, soap, noodles and oil. Helen hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with the cooperative.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, soap, noodles and oil.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is thankful for the initial capital she took from Paglaum MPC. She is a Microfinance Member and was able to roll her earnings and expand her small time business. 

Recently, she took a loan to buy inventories of sugar, biscuits, oil, and canned goods. She hopes to be successful in her business and wants to renovate her house in the near future.

loans.use: To buy inventories of sugar, biscuits, oil, and canned goods

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 59 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc., to sell. She has been in this business for 35 years.

Ruth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 58 years old and widowed, with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her personal products retail business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marilyn has taken a PHP 9,600 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pedicure (service) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase nail polish, nippers, pushers, etc., needed for her pedicure (service) business. Shehas been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from selling vegetables.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, nippers, pushers, etc., needed in her business

loans.name: Sopheas

texts.en:
Sopheas, 36 years old and the mother of two children, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Sopheas is a garment factory worker who can make a net profit of USD 6 per day. So far, it is five years that she has been a garment factory worker.

The garment factory is located far from her house and it takes a long time to reach the factory by bike. To save time, she is borrowing a loan from HKL to buy a motorbike to ride to work. Sopheas would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Angel Lee

texts.en:
Angel Lee thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. She has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase roofing materials for house renovation. She wants to have a good roof and live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase roofing materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Enma Lucrecia

texts.es: Enma es una señora muy trabajadora, ella es madre soltera tiene 6 hijas de las cuales una de 15 años esta estudiando, sus otras hijas ya no estudiaron por falta de recursos economicos, Enma se dedica a la crianza de pollos para despues venderlos asados, a este negocio se dedica en las tardes y en la mañana se dedica de empleadad domestica en una casa, comenta Enma que sus hijas trabajan al jornal, en ocaciones las chicas se van  a recabar en los terrenos que ya han cosechado otras personas para ver si se les quedo alguna papa o cual sea el producto que hayan cosechado, para de esta forma tener algo mas para preparar y servirse diariamente, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, Enma espera mejorar su negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijas.
texts.en: Enma is a very hard-working lady. She is a single mother of 6 daughters, of whom the 15-year-old is a student. Her other daughters don't study any more due to lack of economic resources. Enma works raising chickens to later sell them roasted.  She works in this business in the afternoons and in the mornings she works as a domestic worker in a house. Enma says that her daughters work as day laborers, and sometimes the girls go to glean in the fields that other people have already harvested in order to see if there is a potato or some other product that has been harvested left behind, in order to in this way have something to make and serve daily. The loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens.  Enma hopes to improve the business to get her daughters ahead.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Verginia has been in this business for one year. Verginia earns additional income from seaweeds culture.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Marie Josie

texts.en:
Marie Josie has rented a stall for her retailing business. She is a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC and was able to take her initial loans from the cooperative. 

Now she has applied for a loan to purchase inventories of rice to sell. Marie Josie hopes to sustain her business and to sufficiently provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase inventories of rice to sell.

loans.name: Panimatzam Group

texts.es: Zoila tiene 47 años de edad, (es la que aparece de tercero en la foto, de blusa blanca y suéter rosado, de izquierda a derecha en la primera fila) vive en el municipio de San Andrés Semetabaj, departamento de Sololá, tiene 4 hijos, los tres primeros ya casados viven en otras casas, el último tiene 17 años de edad, Zoila se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol desde hace 15 años, comenta que estos cultivos son resistentes a los cambios climáticos y es seguro que le deja buena ganancia, y son productos de mucha demanda porque son la base alimentaria de la comunidad, además cultiva arveja china y brócoli, Zoila necesita un crédito para comprar insumos (semillas, abono orgánico, abono químico entre otros) para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, el sueño de Zoila es incrementar en cantidad sus cultivos y así poder generar más ganancia y cubrir los gastos de la familia.
texts.en: Zoila is 47 years old (in the photo, she is the third person from the left in the front row, wearing a white blouse and pink sweater). She lives in the municipality of San Andrés Semetabaj, in the department of Sololá. She has four children; the older three are already married and live in their own homes, and the youngest is 17 years old. Zoila has worked for 15 years growing corn and beans. She comments that these crops are resistant to climatic changes, and they reliably provide her with good earnings. They are products in great demand because they are the basic foods of the community. In addition she also grows Chinese peas and broccoli. Zoila needs a loan to buy supplies (seeds, organic fertilizer and chemical fertilizer, among others) for her corn and bean crops. Zoila's dream is to increase the quantity of her crops so that she can generate more earnings and cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies to grow rice and beans.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es: Luz Dary es una joven de 22 años de edad que actualmente vive con sus padres y por ser una mujer criada en el campo ha visto sus oportunidades muy reducidas pues la actividad principal de su sector es la agricultura donde todavía nos e desenvuelve, trabaja como vendedora de minutos recibiendo un sueldo fijo mensual que no alcanza para cubrir la totalidad de sus gastos ayudándole solo con una mínima parte. En busca de superarse y mejorar su calidad y estilo de vida comenzara con una venta de productos de aseo personal llevando a su sector productos poco visto pero quizás sean un éxito pues una persona siempre quiere verse bien. Por ello todo el crédito será para la compra de insumos que distribuirá puerta a puerta sin descuidar su actual empelo con el sueño de tener una indecencia económica con respecto a sus padres
texts.en: Luz Dary is a 22-year-old young woman who currently lives with her parents and, being a woman raised in the countryside, has seen her opportunities are very limited since the primary work in her area is agriculture where one still does not get out of hardship. She works selling minutes, getting a fixed monthly salary that isn't enough to cover all her expenses, only helping to pay a small part of them. In search of improving herself and improving her quality of life, she will begin to sell personal hygiene products, bringing in products seldom seen in her area, but perhaps they will be a success because a person always wants to look good. For this, all of the loan will be for the purchase of supplies that she will sell door to door, without leaving her current job, with the dream to having economic independence from her parents.

loans.use: to begin to sell household products to have economic independence from her parents and to be able to help them with the household expenses.

loans.name: Jhon Fredy

texts.es: Jon un humilde Moto-taxista el cual inicio su labor hace aproximadamente 4 años cuando quedo desempleado y busco alternativas e identifico el potencial laboral que podría generar enrolarse en el oficio de las venta, pero debido a la preocupación que le genera su vehículo ha optad por parar sus laborales hasta tener su moto taxi en excelentes estado para garantizar a las personas que lleguen a su destino sana y tranquilas, por esta razón y ante la falta de capital solicita un crédito para realizar un mantenimiento en general del vehículo y pintarlo mejorando su aspecto. Jon se sueña con tener una franquicia de carros para el transporte de personas brindando una solución rápida y oportuna a los problemas de movilidad que aquejan a los habitantes de su ciudad
texts.en:
Jhon is a modest motorcycle taxi driver who began his work approximately 4 years ago when he was unemployed. He searched for alternatives and identified the work potential that he could generate by going into this business.  Due to concern for his vehicle, he has chosen to stop work until he has his motorcycle taxi in excellent condition to ensure that people get to their destinations safely and peacefully.  

For this reason and due to the lack of capital he is requesting a loan to carry out some general maintenance of the vehicle and to paint it to improve its appearance.  Jon dreams of having a franchise of cars for transporting people, offering a fast and opportune solution to the mobility problems that the inhabitants of his city face.

loans.use: to do some general repairs to his vehicle to continue operating and to paint his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Isabel es una mujer laboriosa de 23 años de edad, casada, quien es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, el negocio lo impulso hace cinco años de los ahorros cuando trabajo en una panadería, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de básicos como es arroz, frijol, aceite, azúcar, sal, papel higiénico, servilletas, pan, chiverías, gaseosas, etc., con el crédito anterior la socia obtuvo mayores ganancias porque invirtió en productos que antes no ofrecía, lo que la ha motivado a seguir prestando en esta institución.
texts.en: Isabel is a hardworking woman who is 23 years old, married and who is the proprietor of a small grocery store in her home.  She got the business going about five years ago using savings from when she worked in a bakery.  She is requesting the loan to purchase some basics like rice, beans, oil, sugar, salt, toilet paper, napkins, bread, snacks, soft drinks, etc.  With the previous loan she obtained greater earnings because she invested in products that she hadn’t offered before, which has motivated her to continue borrowing from this institution.

loans.use: to buy basic staples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Alex Alfredo

texts.es:
Alex es un joven emprendedor, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Camaná junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante,desde hace varios años trabaja en un restaurante realizando repartos por Delivery y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, amable y respetuosa con los clientes.
Alex está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un juego de sala para que de esta manera sienta mayor comodidad y pueda disfrutar momentos agradables junto a su familia. Así seguirá esforzándose para  más adelante poder cumplir su gran sueño: "Estudiar una carrera profesional y ser un gran profesional"
texts.en:
Alex is an enterprising young man. He is 21 years old, single, and lives in Camaná with his family.

He is a person with great desire to get ahead, and for several years has worked in a restaurant doing deliveries and it has gone very will for him because he is a very hard-working, responsible, friendly person and is very respectful to the customers.

Alex is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support they have offered him, he will be able to purchase a living room set and so in this way feel more comfortable and to be able to enjoy good times with his family. So, he will continue to work really hard so that in the future he will be able to realize his big dream: To study a professional major and be a great professional.

loans.use: to purchase a living room set.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José aprendió del oficio de estampado y calcomanías a raiz del trabajo en una empresa para la cual laboro durante varios años, cuando culmino su contrato y recibió su liquidación decidió montar su propio taller de estampado y diseño de calcomanías.
Trabaja todos los días y ofrece servicios de marcado y calcomanías en motos, automóviles y bicicletas, además del servicio de decorado de habitaciones, fabricación de pasacalles y diseño de pendones.
Es un joven muy inteligente y trabajador.
Una de sus mayores dificultades es la realización de registros contables, pero confía en su ingenio para superar esto y formalizar así su negocio.
El aspira a un crédito para la compra de materia prima como adhesivos y papel transparente, con estos elementos podrá continuar con su trabajo y seguirá ofreciendo estos magníficos servicios.
A pesar de su corta edad, tiene la madurez para asumir estas responsabilidades y manejar su negocio de manera efectiva.
texts.en:
José learned the work of stamping and making decals at his job in a business where he worked for several years.  When his contract ended and he got his settlement, he decided to open his own graphics and decal business.  

He works every day and offers services of graphics and decals on motorcycles, cars, and bicycles, in addition to the service of decorating rooms, making banners and designing stand-up rolling banners. 

He is a very intelligent and hard-working young man.

One of his greatest difficulties is doing the bookkeeping, but he is confident that his ingenuity will overcome this and he will be able to formalize his business in this way.

He wants a loan to purchase raw materials such as adhesives and transparent paper. With these things, he will be able to continue with his work and continue offering these magnificent services.

Despite his young age, he has the maturity to take on these responsibilities and run his business effectively.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as adhesives and transparent paper.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. Merlyn has restarted her pig fattening business and is now requesting a PHP 9,835 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Merlyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family

loans.name: Jose Eliecer

texts.es:
El señor José es una persona amable y servicial, muy conocido en el municipio de El Peñol por su buen humor y simpatía, se gana la vida con el transporte de personas en un automóvil que tiene desde hace muchos años, además ofrece el servicio de encomiendas en las veredas cercanas al municipio; es una actividad que viene realizando desde hace muchos años.
Aspira a recibir un aliento económico para realizar mantenimiento general al motor de su vehículo ya que actualmente presenta fallas, también para la compra de algunos repuestos que le hacen falta y el cambio de su cojineria.
Es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor, madruga todos los días para prestar sus servicios a todos los habitantes de la región.
texts.en: José is a friendly and helpful person, well known in the municipality of El Peñol for his good humor and kindness. He makes his living transporting people in his automobile that he has had for many years. He also offers delivery service in the villages close to the municipality. He has done this for many years. He hopes to receive an economic boost to do general maintenance on the motor of his vehicle as it has problems. he will also buy some replacement parts that he needs and replace the upholstery in his car. He is a hard-working and enterprising man who gets up early every day to give service to the people of his area.

loans.use: to preform maintenance on his vehicle and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment for his music studio.

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor has mastered her business, which she has been running for six years now. With a family to feed, she thought that she could use her selling abilities and earn a living. 

Maricor never hesitated to sign up to join the Cooperative to gain financial assistance. Consequently, she received a loan to restock her store with shampoo, detergents, noodles, and milk to sell. Maricor hopes to expand her store by opening another stall at the market to earn additional income.

loans.use: To restock her store with shampoo, detergents, noodles, and milk to sell

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable selling business in the Philippines. Analie has been in this business for 10 years now. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a box of vegetables to sell.

In the future, Analie would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a box of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mereil

texts.en:
Mereil is 56 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom are in school. Mereil and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out by the storm. 

Mereil is taking out a housing loan of PHP 9,871 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Mereil has been a borrower with NWTF since 2013. She plans to recover through her tailoring business. With your help, Mereil can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 58 years old and a widow with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 20 years

Carmen requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra de 37 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos, estudio hasta 5º grado, esta acompañada, su compañero de vida se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura.

Sandra se dedica a trabajar como tortillera desde hace 3 años, empezó trabajando en su casa y ahí efectuó las primeras ventas, su jornada empieza desde muy temprano, ya que a las 5 de la mañana empieza su día de labores.


El dinero lo utilizara en la compra de maíz, ya que con este podrá seguir trabajando en la elaboración y venta de tortillas.


Su deseo es mantener el negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Sandra is a 37 year old mother of two children. She studied up to Grade 5. She is in a common-law relationship and her life partner is a farmer. Sandra has worked making tortillas for the past 3 years. She started this work from her house and made her first few sales. Her day begins very early as at 5 am she has started her labors. She will use the money from the loan to buy corn. With this she can continue to make and sell tortillas. Her goal is to maintain her business and improve the quality of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn to continue with making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: María Dorila

texts.es:
