María de 47 años de edad, no estudio ya que desde que era una niña se dedicó a los oficios del hogar,  tenía que ayudarle a su mamá en los quehaceres debido a que ella estaba enferma y no podía realizar muchos esfuerzo; fue así como ella no pudo asistir a la escuela.

Esta casada,  su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y son padres de dos hijos, un varón que falleció con solo 8 meses de nacido y una hija quien estudio hasta 7° grado, ella vive con ellos y sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera, son una familia muy unida ya que todos trabajan con el fin de salir adelante con todos los gastos del hogar y darles el estudio a los niños de la casa.

Ella tiene que levantarse muy temprano para realizar todos los quehaceres del hogar para luego dedicarse a los oficios de sastrería,  ya que ella aprendió cuando tenía 13 años, ella le ayudaba a una vecina a reparar daños en ropa hasta que aprendió a la perfección y hoy se dedica a la elaboración de uniformes para el Centro Escolar de la comunidad, en esto le ayuda su hija para salir con todos los pedidos al día en que  estipula el contrato, el trabajo es en su casa así que ella no tiene que trasladarse a ningún lugar para ejercerlo y el horario también es variado.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla de maíz y frijol, abono, foliares, pesticidas y herbicidas  para los cultivos que realiza su esposo. Teniendo todo esto en su casa ellos podrán aplicarlos a tiempo y así asegurarse que sus cultivos no pierdan el crecimiento ni la producción, los compraran más baratos y de una sola vez.

Ella desea poder tener más trabajo como sastre para tener mejores ingresos y con las ganancias ella podrá hacer más grande su vivienda, para darle a sus nietos una mejor calidad de vida que la que ella tubo cuando era una niña,  así como la que le dio a su hija cuando era una niña desea que los esfuerzos que ella realiza por ahorita sean de provecho para el futuro, desea que la producción de granos básicos sea muy buena.
texts.en:
María, 47 years old, didn't go to school because since she was a child she took care of the household tasks. She had to help her mom with the chores because she was sick and couldn't do much work. For this reason, she couldn't go to school. 

She is married. Her husband works in agriculture and they are parents of two children, one boy who died only 8 months after being born and a daughter who studied up to the 7th grade. She lives with them and her two children since she is a single mother. They are a very close family in which all work with the goal of getting ahead with all the household expenses and providing school to the children in the house. 

She has to get up very early to do all the household chores to later work in her tailoring business, which she learned when she was 13. She helped a neighbor to repair clothing until she learned it perfectly and today she works making uniforms for the community school. In this, her daughter helps her finish all the orders for the day that is stipulated in the contract. The work is in her home, so she doesn't have to go anywhere to do it, and the schedule is also varied. 

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase corn and bean seeds, manure, fertilizer absorbed through the leaves, pesticides, and herbicides for the crops that her husband grows.  Having this all in the house, they can work in time and make sure that the crops don't lose growth or production.  They will purchase them more cheaply and all at once. 

She wants to be able to have more work as a tailor to have more income and, with the earnings, she could make her house larger, to give her grandchildren a better quality of live than she had when she was a girl.  As she gave her efforts to her daughter when she was young, she wants her efforts that she does now to benefit the future; she wants the grain crop to be very good.

loans.use: to purchase corn and bean seeds, manure, fertilizer absorbed through the leaves, pesticides, and herbicides for the crops that her husband grows.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 25 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. Jeanette runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Jeanette requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel de 65 años de edad, esta acompañado, padre de 9 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, en la casa solo viven con él 2 nietos.

Fidel se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño, hoy en día siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, para llegar al lugar donde siembra tiene que caminar aproximadamente 2 kilómetros, Fidel se traslada a pie.

El préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de semilla, veneno y para pagar el arrendamiento del terreno para cultivar maíz.


Su deseo es cosechar lo suficiente, para tener maíz todo el año, tener energía eléctrica en su casa y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Fidel, 65 years old, is partnered and father of 9 children.  His partner takes care of the domestic tasks, and in the house, only 2 grandchildren live with him.

Fidel has worked in agriculture since he was a boy. These days he grows 14,000 square meters of corn. To get the place he cultivates, he has to work approximately 2 kilometers. Fidel goes by foot. 

The loan will be used to purchase seeds, pesticide and to pay the rent for the land where he grows corn. 

His desire is to harvest enough to have corn for the whole year, have electricity in his house, and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticide, and to pay for the rent of the land where he grows corn.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 9,907.60 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home, and to pay for construction labor. Merlyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is 57 years old, and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Daisy has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ma. Edna works hard to support her family. She has a nipa (palm) roof making business in the Philippines.

Ma. Edna is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her nipa roof making business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. Ma. Edna hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her nipa (palm) roof making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an overlocker.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Joan has been in this business for five years now.

Joan requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 55 years old, widowed, and the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosemarie has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 51 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Josephine has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 20 years

Josephine requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Juana es una mujer emprendedora de 45 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo quien ha sido motivo para su superación, es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, además comercializa ropa nueva y de segunda a los pobladores de su comunidad el crédito lo solicita para la compra de gaseosas, jugos, sopas maggui, sopas marucham, huevos, variedad de ropa, etc., con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado aumentar el negocio y la compra de bienes personales.
texts.en:
Juana is an enterprising woman who is 45 years old, married and the mother of a son who has been the reason why she has gotten ahead. She owns a small grocery store in her home, and she also sells both new and secondhand clothing to the members of her community.

She is requesting this loan to purchase soft drinks, juices, soups, ramen noodles, eggs and a variety of clothing. With her previous loans, she has been able to increase her business and to purchase more personal goods.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, juices, soups, ramen noodles, eggs and a variety of clothes.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: La señora Mayra es una mujer emprendedora de 38 años de edad, casada, se dedica al destace de cerdo en su domicilio, cuenta con el apoyo financiero de su esposo, el negocio lo impulso con un fondo que tenían ahorrado de la liquidación de su esposo, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de dos cerdos en pies, con el fin de ofrecerle un producto de calidad a los pobladores y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Mayra is an enterprising woman, 38 years old, married, who works butchering pigs in her home. She has her husband's financial support.  She began her business with an amount of money they had saved from her husband's settlement. The loan she asks for is to purchase two live pigs with the goal to offer a better quality of product to the townspeople and to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase two live pigs

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
José de 44 años de edad, se encuentra casado, padre de 3 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, mientras  José se dedica a la agricultura y al cuido de una sandillera.

El dinero sera invertido en la compra de foliares para la sandillera, ya que esto le permitirá obtener mayor producción y mejorara sus ingresos.

Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda, y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida, seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos para darles una buena enseñanza.
texts.en:
José, 44 years old, is married and the father of 3 children. His wife takes care of the household duties while José works in agriculture taking care of a watermelon field.

The money will be invested in purchasing fertilizers that are spread on the leaves of the watermelon plants, since this will allow him to get a larger production and increase his income. 

His dream is to improve his house, and with this improve his quality of life, and continue working to get his children ahead in order to give them a good education.

loans.use: To purchase liquid fertilizers to spread on the leaves of the watermelon field, since this will permit him to get a better production and increase his income.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es:
Alba de 52 años de edad, no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar, solo aprendió a firmar, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, solo una hija depende de ella, ya que la otra es empleada.

Ella tiene una venta de verduras en el mercado desde hace cuatro años, la distancia de su hogar hasta donde ella trabaja es de unos 25 minutos.

El dinero lo utilizara en la compra de verduras, como zanahorias, lechuga, papas, guisguil, rábanos, cebolla, chiles, tomates, etc ya que sus ventas se han incrementado y con el dinero estará ampliando su negocio y brindando un mejor servicio.

Su sueño es tener un local propio en el mercado, mejorar su calidad de vida y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alba is 52 years old. She never had the chance to study, and she only learned to sign her name. She is the single mother of two children, but only one still depends on her; the other works as an employee. 

She has sold vegetables in the market for four years. The distance from her home to where she works is about 25 minutes. She will use the money from the loan to purchase vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, potatoes, pear squash, radishes, onions, chilies and tomatoes because her sales have increased. With the money, she is growing her business and providing better service.

Her dream is to have her own stall in the market, to improve her quality of life and to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, potatoes, pear squash, radish, onions, chilies and tomatoes.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta de 46 años de edad, no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar y por ello solo aprendió a firmar, es casada, su compañero de vida trabaja en la agricultura, tienen 4 hijos pero solo 2 viven con ellos.

Marta y su pareja siempre se han dedicado a la agricultura, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres ya que desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a este trabajo. Ahora que esta casada, su esposo realiza el trabajo de la agricultura y ella se dedica al  cuido del hogar.

El préstamo sera utilizado en la compra de veneno, semilla,  abono y para cancelar a los ayudantes para cultivar maíz.

Su deseo es mejorar su vivienda,seguir trabajando para asegurar su alimentación y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 46 years old. She did not have to chance to study, and only learned how to sign her name. She is married, and her partner works in agriculture. They have 4 children, but only 2 of them still live with them.

Marta and her partner have always worked in agriculture. She learned to farm from her parents, and she has worked in this job since she was very young. Now that she is married, her husband does the agricultural work, and she takes care of their home.

The loan will be used to purchase weed killer, seeds and fertilizers, and to pay the helpers that grow corn. Her dream is to improve their home and continue working to make sure her family can eat and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase weed killer, seeds, fertilizer and to pay her helpers to grow corn.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора родилась в 1982 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Ее муж сварщик. Нигора занимается производством и продажей варений и компотов. Также она в летнее время занимается купле продажей арбузов. Она продает арбузы на местном рынке. Она с бизнесом справляется сама. Нигора является основной кормилицей семьи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки арбузов для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nigoda was born in 1982. She is married and has two young children. Her husband is a welder. Nigora makes and sells jams and compote. In the summer she also buys and sells watermelon at the local market. She takes care of the business herself and is the main breadwinner for the family. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy watermelon and increase working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy watermelon and increase working capital

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Myrna is 37 years old and three of her children are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets, gasoline, wood, etc.

Myrna has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, gasoline, wood, etc.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 38 years old and married with three children, who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lorena has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is 60 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending business and is committed to regaining what she lost. She is taking out a PHP 9,557.10 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Nenita has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 42 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell. Analyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en: Hazel is 27 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Hazel has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 57 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Saturnina works very hard to provide for them.

Saturnina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Saturnina has been in this business for 24 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Saturnina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 34 years old and married with two children, who are in school. Mary Joy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Mary Joy has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future Mary Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 60 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Gloria has been raising pigs for 10 years, and earns some additional income from buying and selling rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Berta de 45 años de edad, es ama de casa y no cuarenta con ningún nivel académico que es una persona que ya mayor de edad aprendió a leer un poco porque es su infancia no tuvo la oportunidad que sus padres le enviaran a ningún centro educativo, pero ella les dio la oportunidad a sus dos hijos que estudiaran hasta nivel básico y en la actualidad ellos se encuentran casados pero siempre le apoyan con su hogar. Berta vive junto a su hijo de 27 años de edad como también su nuera de 26 años de edad y una nieta de 5 añitos que se encuentra yendo a primaria.

Berta realiza la actividad de oficios domésticos, como también la  producción de granos básico junto con su hijo para la sostenibilidad de su familia, ya que dicha actividad la aprendió cuando su esposo la realizaba y ella siempre le apoyaba.
 
Berta utiliza el dinero del crédito para la finalización de la construcción de un baño y una fosa para aguas servidas de su familia,  ya que los materiales los ha comprado con pequeños ahorros que ha ido obteniendo por un buen tiempo pero en esta oportunidad desea complementarla. 

Berta  pretende obtener una vivienda digna que reúna las condiciones de seguridad para su familia y que su nieta obtenga un buen nivel académico
texts.en:
Berta is 45 years old. She is a homemaker, and she does not have any schooling at all. She is a person who learned to read a little when she was already an adult, because in her childhood she didn't have the opportunity. Her parents didn't send her to any school, but she gave this opportunity to her two children, who went to elementary school. Currently, her children are married, but they are still helping support her household. Berta lives with her 27-year-old son, her 26-year-old daughter-in-law and a little granddaughter who is 5 years old and attending primary school. 

Berta works taking care of household chores, and she also grows staple food crops together with her son to support the family. She learned this work when her husband did it, and she always helped him. 

Berta will use the funds from the loan to finish constructing a bathroom for her family and a septic tank for wastewater. She has already purchased the materials with a small amount of savings which she had been building up for quite a while, but on this occasion she wants to complement them. 

Berta intends to create a home where her family can live with dignity and in safety, and she wants her granddaughter to get a good education.

loans.use: to finish constructing a bathroom and a septic tank for her family.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 52 years old, a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Victoria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for two years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 62 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried coconut meat. Helen has been in this business for 10 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried coconut meat

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 53 years old, married, and has one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. Jocelyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 57 years old and married with two children. Nida works very hard to provide for them.

Nida's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Nida has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Nida has taken a PHP 8,700 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Nida is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sunshine

texts.en:
Sunshine is 22 years old and married with one child in school, Sunshine works very hard to provide for them.

Sunshine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Sunshine has been in this business for four years. 

In the future Sunshine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana is a member in good standing with the Cooperative. She earned this membership status by religiously paying all her obligations in a timely fashion. She is thankful that PMPC never hesitated to extend support for all her financial needs. Recently, Feliciana applied for a loan to buy stock of soft drinks and other beverages. She hopes to live comfortably with all her children established in their own chosen careers.

loans.use: to buy stock of soft drinks and other beverages

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: A 53-year-old businesswoman and mother is from Casusan, Aloran. She is Jacinta, who diligently maintains her store and takes care of her family.  She also protects her membership with Paglaum MPC so she can always avail herself of financial assistance in times of uncertainty. Jacinta has taken a loan to purchase more stock of soft drinks and canned goods to sell. She hopes to repay her loans without default. She smiles at the thought of seeing all her children earn their diplomas someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of soft drinks and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 34 years old and has two children.  She is married and both of her children are in school.

Roselyn and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Roselyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,600 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Roselyn has been with NWTF as a borrower since 2010. She plans to recover through her fishing business.

With your help, Roselyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like woods, nails, and pay laborers' salaries.

Virgie has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Virgie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like woods, nails, and pay laborers' salaries

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Melly works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling peanuts. Melly is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like yeast, flour, margarine, etc. for her bakery business.

Melly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like yeast, flour, margarine, etc

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Mercy works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling recycled materials. Mercy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Julita

texts.en:
Ma. Julita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing business. Ma. Julita has been in this business for 17 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Melgrace

texts.en:
Melgrace is 32 years old and married with five children.  With three children in school, Melgrace works very hard to provide for them.

Melgrace's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Melgrace has restarted her pig fattening business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Melgrace has taken a PHP 9,360 housing loan through NWTF to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Melgrace is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, sugar, rice, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Crispina has been in this business for six years. Crispina earns more income from buying and selling native products and buying and selling rice grains.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, rice, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lea Mae

texts.en:
Lea Mae is 22 years old and has three children, one of whom is in school.

Lea Mae is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 37-year-old married Ugandan man with five children, of whom four attend school. He is not only a miller but also a mechanic which generates income for him. The only factor that has prompted him to acquire a loan is to buy a bigger milling machine. His future hope is to see himself a millionaire as he wishes his income to increase. Edward is challenged by inadequate capital which at times makes him fail to achieve his targets.

loans.use: to buy a bigger milling machine.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 38 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, eggs, rice, charcoal, soap, oil, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Daisy has borrowed and paid back 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sugar, eggs, rice, charcoal, soap, oil, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también muele en un molino. Son padres de 5 hijos de los cuales solo una vive con ellos.  

Carlos es agricultor que aprendió el oficio desde que tenía 10 años de edad, este oficio se lo enseño el padre ya que él era un joven que le gustaba mucho andar con el papá y fue así como aprendió el trabajo,  hoy en día Carlos  le agradece al papá por haberlo enseñado  este trabajo  y fue así como él ha aprendido este oficio, el terreno en donde trabaja esta a una distancia de 15 minutos y viaja en un carro que ha comprado con mucho esfuerzo que también le sirve para llevar una máquina que desgrana maíz; porque en la época que sacan los cultivos a él lo buscan para que desgrane las cosechas en este trabajo se involucra un hijo que ya esta en hogar aparte pero que le ayuda para poder sacar todo las cosechas de los habitantes del cantón.

con el préstamo solicitado lo necesitara para comprar 6 sacos de abono, que ya la milpa está en el punto de poder tirarle la segunda abonada donde el abono hace la fuerza para que el cultivo eché abundantemente esto le ayudara mucho, ya que él va a tirarle suficiente abono y así la milpa será muy buena cosecha.

Los sueños que tiene es tener salud y poder tener un cultivo que le ajuste para mantener a su familia y que de las ganancias primero Dios comprar otra máquina para así poder cubrir todo los trabajos que le salen.
texts.en:
55-year-old Carlos studied up to ninth grade and is married. His wife does the household chores and also grinds in a mill. They are the parents of 5 children, of which only one lives with them. 

Carlos is a farmer who started this work when he was 10 years old. His father taught him this work, as he was a young man who liked to go around with his dad. That´s how he learned how to do the job. Today, Carlos is grateful to his dad for having taught him this work. The land where he works is 15 minutes away and he gets there in a car that took a lot of effort to buy. It also allows him to transport a corn de-kernelling machine. During the period when they harvest, they hire him to de-kernel the harvest. One of his sons that lives in his own home helps him with this work so he can harvest the crops for all of the residents of the region. 

He will need the requested loan to buy 6 bags of fertilizer, as it´s time to put the second round of fertilizer on the corn. This is when the fertilizer works to make the harvest more abundant, and will help a lot. He´s going to put enough fertilizer so that the corn will have a really good harvest.

His dreams are to be healthy and to have a harvest that will support his family. God-willing, from the first earnings he will buy another machine so that he can do all of the work that comes.

loans.use: to buy 6 bags of fertilizer, as it´s time to put the second round of fertilizer on the corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make bread, such as flour, butter, sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 45 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school.

Elena is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elena has been farming rice for 24 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is a twenty-seven-year-old female. She does tailoring and sells clothes. She also trains students in tailoring to earn extra income. She has been in business for five years and hopes to increase her output. However, she is challenged by price changes which affect her projected income. Zainabu is a hardworking woman in need of a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dally

texts.en:
Dally is 53 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like milo, rice, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Dally has borrowed and paid back 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like milo, rice, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods and feed. Cristina is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Charily

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Charily works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Charily is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Charily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 33 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 31 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Leonida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Panimatzalam Ii Group

texts.es: Elva Maria tiene 26 años de edad, (es la que aparece en la foto de último de la fila de atrás, de blusa celeste y suéter blanco, de izquierda a derecha), tiene dos hijos; el primero tiene 5 años de edad, el segundo tiene 3 años de edad, todavía no asisten a la escuela, Elva Maria se dedica a cultivar arveja china, cultiva arveja china porque tiene un comprar seguro y casi no pierde nada de su cosecha y le paga un mejor precio que en el mercado, lleva 8 años de estar cultivando, es bien trabajadora porque aprovecha una pequeña parcela para realizar esta actividad y es de su propiedad, además de la arveja china, ella cultiva maíz, frijol, flores y vende ropa típica, Elva Maria necesita un crédito para comprar insumos (semilla, abono orgánico, abono químico, foliares e insecticida entre otros) para el cultivo de arveja china, con las ganancias Elva Maria piensa construir una casa donde vivir mejor y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Elva Maria is 26 years old (she is the one in the photo that is at the end in the back, wearing the light blue top and white sweater, from left to right). She has two children; the first is five years old, the second is three years old and they do not attend school yet. 

Elva Maria makes a living growing sweet peas, and because she has a safe buyer, she loses almost nothing from her crop and he gives her a better price than at the market. She has been farming for eight years, and she is a hard-worker because she makes the most out of a small plot of land to do this work, which is on her property. In addition to growing sweet peas, she grows corn, beans, flowers and she sells traditional clothing. 

Elva Maria needs a loan to buy supplies (seeds, organic fertilizer, chemical fertilizer, fertilizers absorbed through the plant leaves and insecticide among other items) to grow the sweet peas. With the earnings, Elva Maria is thinking of building a house for a better life and to support her children so they go to school.

loans.use: to buy supplies to grow sugar peas.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat, 41, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five children, one of whom is already married. To make a living, she works as a farmer in a small rice field which is located just behind her house. So far, it has been more than 20 years that she has been involved in this farming business, which can earn a net profit of USD 5 per day.

Sophat wants to increase her family income by opening a small store to sell Khmer food and rice near the garment factory. Now she is borrowing a loan from HKL to buy some construction supplies for her small store. Sophat would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product

loans.use: to buy some construction supplies for a small store.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 58 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. Dominga runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, oil, sugar, soap, etc.

Dominga has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run her general store for 10 years, and also earns an income by buying and selling dried coconut meat.

Dominga aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, oil, sugar, soap, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn is 27 years old and married with two children; one attends school.  Lovelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Lovelyn's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lovelyn has restarted her food vending business and needs to provide a safe shelter for her family.

Lovelyn has taken a PHP 9714.20 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She will also pay for construction labor.

Lovelyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 40 year old Ugandan man who sells Pozzollana, a raw material used to produce cement in the construction industry. 

He not only sell Pozzollana but he also farms to generate additional income, to empower his family economically.

Robert needs a loan to pay for labor to quarry Pozzollana. He wishes to diversify his business in the near future. However, he is challenged by weather changes, especially the rainy seasons which affect querying and transportation of raw materials.

loans.use: to pay for labor to quarry stone.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from pig fattening.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Elizabeth has sustained her business with 30 previous loans from NWTF. 

She hopes her hard work will help her attain her dream, to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is a 44-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lalaine's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her pig fattening business and is committed to regain what she lost. Lalaine is taking out a PHP 9,714 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Lalaine has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Lalaine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income through fish vending and by raising pigs. 

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and gasoline for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requested additional money to further build her business.

Evelyn has sustained her business activities with the help of 23 previous loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and gasoline.

loans.name: Adelisa

texts.en:
Adelisa is taking a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk to generate income for her family. 

Adelisa will use her loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as Fanta, Coke, Sprite, fish, oils, coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes and candle.  

Adelisa opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $400.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock for her kiosk.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng, 33, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two school children and one married child. To make a living, she works as a farmer in a small rice field which is located near her house.  So far, she has been involved in this farming business for more than ten years. It can earn her a net profit of USD 4 per day.

Sokheng wants to buy baby pigs to raise and sell when they are older as a source of supplementary income for her family. Now she is borrowing a loan from HKL to buy baby pigs to raise and sell.  Sokheng would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy baby pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Felissa

texts.en:
Felissa is 65 years old and comes from Aloran. She is married and manages a car radiator repair shop together with her husband. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional bronze rods, flux, copper, and other accessories and materials for their radiator repair shop business. 

Felissa has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to expand their radiator repair shop business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bronze rods, flux, copper, and other accessories and materials

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her general store business and is now requesting a PHP 5,364 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Margie will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Eximila

texts.en:
Eximila is 43 years old and married with four children, who are in school, Eximila works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct selling business for personal products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. She has been in this business for eight years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Iluminada works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Iluminada is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Iluminada has been sustaining her business activities through her last loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey lives in Hoima Uganda. He is a 32-year-old hard working married man with two children between the ages of three and six. He is in the motorcycle (boda boda) business and gets additional income from farming. He started the business to take care of his family. His clients are the general public. His dream is to grow and have more motorcycles on the road but limited capital and bad roads cause constant mechanical breakdowns hindering business growth. He needs a loan to buy another motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
$800.00 is offered to Anastacia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as oils, body lotion, noodles, sugar, salt, milk and cigarettes. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Anastacia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy oils, body lotion, noodles, sugar, salt, milk and cigarettes.

loans.name: Mti Mrefu Group

texts.en:
Maimuna, who is in her early 50s is married with four children with one still in school.  She has been running several businesses.  She has been selling charcoal, fish and fabrics for six years now. She works from 7:00 am to 8.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Maimuna's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling charcoal, fabrics and bought more fish. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She is doing fine and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She will use this loan to buy charcoal, fish and fabrics to resell.  She dreams of taking her child to a better college.

Maimuna will share this loan with her loan group "Maimuna" with two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, fish and fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to convert his auto to gas.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson used the previous loan to buy general merchandise, such as cooking oil, washing detergents, and sugar to sell. In addition to retail, he has embarked on tea farming to sustain his family. Much as he needs a loan to buy inputs for his tea plantation, he also needs a loan to hire a block of tea to enable him to increase output, leading to increased income and profits as well. He dreams of having a large established tea plantation to become one of the major tea suppliers despite the challenge of the ever-changing weather.

loans.use: to buy inputs and hire a block of tea

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 47 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like rice, charcoal, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Ligaya has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like rice, charcoal, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business and is now requesting a 9,714 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Perpetua will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Perpetua would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gerlie works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Gerlie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, meat, fish, etc for her restaurant business.

Gerlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, meat, fish, etc

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 35 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like rice, charcoal, eggs, shampoo, soap, groceries, etc.

Irene has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like rice, charcoal, eggs, shampoo, soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 59 years old, a married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nida's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Nida is taking out a PHP 8,314 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Nida has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Emna Del Rosario

texts.es:
Una vez que ha alistado a sus dos pequeños para ir a clases, doña Emma procede a abrir su pulpería para recibir a sus primeros clientes a las siete de la mañana, dinámica que ha estado llevando a cabo durante tres años y medio. Todos sus clientes manifiestan estar agradecidos por la atención y productos de calidad que ella ofrece. Tiene 27 años, está casada. Junto a su esposo, comerciante de gorras y fajas ambulante, luchan arduamente por la estabilidad económica de su familia. 
Emma solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos, tales como arroz, frijoles; asimismo condimentos, productos de aseo personal, ropa tanto para niños como adultos, carteras y chinelas para damas, entre otros. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que anhela seguir progresando, aumentar su clientela y al mismo tiempo incrementar sus ganancias, de manera que pueda brindarle bienestar a su familia. Uno de sus planes futuros es comprar un congelador para vender frutas y refrescos, sin duda una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Once she has recruited her two young ones to go to school, Emma proceeds to open her store to welcome her first customers at seven o'clock in the morning, a routine she has repeated for the last three and a half years. 

All her customers say they are grateful for the customer care and for the quality of products she offers. She's 27, and is married. Together with her husband, a travelling salesman of hats and belts, they fight hard for the economic stability of their family.

Emma is requesting a loan to increase inventory; she needs to purchase staples such as rice, beans, grains, as well as condiments, toiletries, clothing for children and adults, purses and slippers for ladies, among others. 

She puts her trust in the loan since she aspires to further advancement, to increase her customer base and at the same time increase profits, such that she can provide well-being for her family. 

One of her future plans is to buy a fridge/freezer to sell fruit and refreshments; without doubt she is a hardworking and enterprising woman.

loans.use: to buy basic staples like rice and neans, and condiments, as well as toiletries, clothing for children and adults, purses and slippers for ladies, among others.

loans.name: Beccy Karen

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos más conocido como Cantón del amor lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, es un lugar muy turístico, por las diversas cascadas y hosterías y el maravilloso clima, aquí se encuentra la cascada del amor al cual se puede llegar muy rápido por el maravilloso teleférico que tienen en este Cantón. Aquí vive la señorita Beccy una señorita luchadora de 20 años ella es soltera no tiene hijos vive en casa de los papás, el papá trabaja en el municipio y la mama tiene un pequeño carrito en el que realiza venta de comida rápida. 
La señorita Beccy trabaja en un salón de belleza del Cantón, solicita este crédito para emprender en su propio negocio, le gustaría tener su salón de belleza, conoce mucho de esta actividad y sabe que es muy rentable, con la experiencia que tiene podrá atraer buena clientela, a este negocio le dedicara un promedio de 10 a 12 horas por día 
Con esta inversión mejorara sus ingresos económicos y su calidad de vida y podrá ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, la señorita Beccy agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is best known as a canton full of love and friendly and hard-working people.  It is a very touristic place because of its diverse waterfalls, its inns, and its marvelous climate.  Here is where the waterfall of love is found.  You can get there very quickly because of the marvelous cable cars in this canton.

This is where Beccy lives.  She is a tenacious 20 year old lady.  She is single, and she does not have children.  She lives in her parents’ house.  Her father works in the municipality, and her mother has a small cart from which she sells fast food.

Beccy works in a beauty salon in the canton.  She is requesting this loan to undertake her own business.  She would like to have a beauty salon.  She knows a lot about this business activity, and she knows that it is very profitable.  With the experience that she has, she will be able to attract good clientele.  She will devote an average of 10 to 12 hours a day to this business.

With this investment she will improve her income and her quality of live.  She will be able to help her parents with the household expenses.

Beccy is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and the opportunity that have been provided.

loans.use: to undertake her own business, a beauty salon.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 37 years old, lives in Batheay District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He is a loving father of four children who are enrolled in school. To make a living, he works as a farmer in a small rice field which is located near his house.  It has been nearly twenty years that he has been involved in farming, which can earn a net profit of USD 5 per day.

Currently, Hong  lacks money for farming supplies. Therefore, he is applying for a loan from KIVA to buy fertilizers, insecticides and other related materials. He would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, insecticides and other related materials

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa has earned a living with her retail store and video-k entertainment business for many years. She earns well for the family. Besides, with her video-k entertainment, she has saved more income. To add inventory capital, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy additional grocery goods and bottled products to sell. She wants to expand her store in order to improve her business for a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods and bottled products to sell

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn, 51​​ ​​​​​years old, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children who are enrolled in school. To make a living, she works as a farmer in a small rice field which is located near her house.  So far, she has been involved for more than twenty years in this farming business which can earn a net profit of USD 5 per day.

Currently, Morn is applying for a loan through KIVA to buy a plot of land. She will build a house on that land  by the end of this year. She would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.
​

loans.use: to buy a plot of land where she can build a house

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 63 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 45,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, can goods, etc.

She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Lolita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, can goods, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a buy and sell of bananas business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Maria has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Maria would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon, Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business and is now requesting a PHP 9714 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.  With your help Rosalie will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of fresh fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. 

Pinky has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buy and sell of vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rocela

texts.en:
Rosela is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosela is 44 years old and three of her children are in school.

Rosela has a butcher meat business in the Philippines. Rosela requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rosela has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rosela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for making sweets.

loans.name: Nep

texts.en:
Nep, a 50-year-old mother of four school children, lives in a rural area of Prasat Bakong District, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she works as a farmer on a small rice field near her house. Her husband is a photographer in the city. Totally, this couple can make USD 10 per day.  

Nep would like to get a loan from HKL. It is the first loan for her to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. She thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is a farmer from Aknashen village of Armavir region. She is divorced and lives there alone. Margarita's only son has moved to Russia to earn money and support his mother financially. Margarita has been engaged in farming for many years. In particular, she owns a greenhouse and cultivates tomatoes, eggplants, and peppers. In order to sustain her agribusiness and grow it further, Margarita has to make some investments. For that reason she has applied for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy 20 bags of fertilizers, pesticides, as well as to compensate her workers' jobs. This hard working woman really needs support to succeed. She will be extremely grateful to all the lenders. Let's help Margarita prove that everybody can overcome life’s difficulties through hard and devoted work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers (20 bags), pesticides and pay the workers.

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is 35 years old and has eight children. She is married and has seven children who are in school.

Robelyn and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013 but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Robelyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to 7,071 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Robelyn has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her pig fattening business.

With your help, Robelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lyziel

texts.en:
Lyziel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Lyziel has been in this business for three years. Lyziel earns more income from buying and selling fertilized duck egg.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support her family. Mary Grace is married and has a dried fish business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.  Mary Grace has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Metelin

texts.en:
Metelin is 40 years old and married.  She has five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling business,  selling Herbalife products in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Metelin has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been selling Herbalife products for  five years and also earns an income from meat vending.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-two-year-old lady. She is married with four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For ten years Mary has practiced cocoa growing that has enabled her to meet her daily family obligations. 

After realizing some savings from her cocoa growing, she decided to start on a food stall in the market, where she sells fish and onions to the locals. Faced with poor means of transportation and debtors, she has managed to keep in business. 

Mary wants a loan to buy fish to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 36-year-old Lebanese married woman of two children. She has worked as a private teacher in her house since 2006. She chooses this profession because she feels that she is helping students to get their needed education. Today, Zeinab is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy new equipment such as a board and notebooks to help her in her work and to improve her teaching skills. She is very optimistic about her future and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to buy new equipment such as a board and notebooks.

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en: Rajaa is a 37-year-old married mother of four children who has been working since three years ago at her house selling homemade foods such as pickles, thyme, and oil to help her family meet the needs of life. She is obtaining a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to ameliorate her business merchandise to give the best product to her clients. Rajaa is very certain that she will sell all products while expanding her business area. She hopes that in the future she might open her own store to be able to attract more customers.

loans.use: to ameliorate her business merchandise.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Sokhoeun, a 44 year-old mother of four children, lives in Batheay District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is the owner of a small pig farm which is located behind her house.  This farming business allows her to make around seven dollars a day.

Sokhoeun wants to make her life more convenient by having a motorbike for daily use in her family. Now she is borrowing from HKL to buy a motorbike. Sokhoeun would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Teodora works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Teodora is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like egg, rice, charcoal, soap, oil, shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Teodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell like egg, rice, charcoal, soap, oil, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lyahinda

texts.en:
Lyahinda is a twenty-one-year-old man. He is married with two children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He is determined to look after his family and expand his business to a big retail shop. He started his business from the small savings he generated from his cocoa selling. He is challenged with the transport of his commodities from the market. 

He intends to use the loan to buy eggs, mineral water, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy eggs, mineral water, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 40 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Imelda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Imelda has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Imelda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 56 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Susan has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Susan has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en:
Emilly runs a vegetable store. She sells different types of vegetables and fruits. She has been in this business for 10 years now. Emilly is married and blessed with three children.

Emilly earns a basic income of KES 10,000 per month and requested a loan of KES 13,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase additional stock of vegetables as well as repair her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables and repair her grocery store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and a widow with 11 children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Erlinda has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 57 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Harriet has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from her boarding house rent.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, and noodles

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 40-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and 3 children. She cooperates with her husband to fulfill her family's needs. In 2012, she decided to start working from her home to clean carpets in order to share some of the responsibilities with her husband. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase cleaning materials for her carpet cleaning job. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with good results.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning materials for her job.

loans.name: Al- Itehad Group

texts.en:
Al- Itehad is a group which comprises of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.

Sidah is the leader of the group. She is a 34 year old married woman. She is an educated woman with secondary level education. She works as a housewife, and she has a lot of work inside her house. Sidah's house lacks home appliances, and she can't afford them. Inside the kitchen of her house, her oven is very old and she needs to buy a new one in order to make good breads, cakes, and other delicious food. Unfortunately, she doesn't have a good oven in order to prepare that delicious food. For this reason, Sidah is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new oven to prepare the delicious bread and cake.

Sidah looks forward to furnishing all her house with new furniture. She hopes to purchase all the home appliances in order to make her house comfortable.
