loans.use: to purchase a new oven to prepare delicious breads and cakes.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 38 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school. Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Lilibeth has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Lilibeth would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Layale

texts.en:
Layale is a 32-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children. She is working hard and trying her best to be as helpful as she can in her family. 

She opened a beauty salon in her house in 2005. She has her loyal customers, and is glad with the results she has attained so far. 

Today, she is looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase new equipment for the beauty salon. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with good-quality products.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for the beauty salon.

loans.name: Roxana Briggitte

texts.es:
Roxana Briggitte tiene 26 años de edad, vive en casa familiar en el Distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una pequeña librería, se dedica a la venta de cuadernos y productos de oficina, también tiene una fotocopiadora con la cual ofrece servicios de fotocopias, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para así aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana Briggitte is 26 years old, she lives in the family home in the District of Cayalti, a community based on agriculture, commerce and livestock farming. It is found in the Province of Chiclayo which is part of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

She has a small bookstore which sells notebooks and office products, she also has a photocopier with which she offers a photocopying service.

Roxana Briggitte has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy merchandise to increase her sales and generate a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as notebooks and office supplies to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 42 years old, married, and blessed with three children, ages 16, 14, and 12. She has been selling clothes for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the entire loan amount to add more inventory of assorted clothes for sale.

Damaris plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. In the future she desires to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Abiya

texts.en:
Abiya is from Dhupguri. She is 38, married and a housewife. She is uneducated and can only sign her name.  Her husband Aijula is 43 years old and studied until grade five.  They live in their own kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made). They have two grown-up sons who do not live with them. They work abroad.

Abiya's husband is a farmer with many years of experience running his agricultural business.  He grows different seasonal vegetables in their ancestral land.  Abiya also helps with this work.  They gather the harvest and sell in their locally and the family somehow manages to support itself.

Now Abiya and her husband would like to enlarge their business in order to have a better lifestyle. Their present income is too scanty to cope with the present price rise of essential commodities.  So, Abiya has taken a loan from BJS.  They have decided to cultivate jute.  They have chosen this crop as it is profitable and there is good demand for the product in the present market.  Abiya has decided to use the loan to buy jute seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other necessary things to start cultivation as the rainy season is the best time to cultivate this crop.

Abiya is an enthusiastic and hardworking woman who believes that hard work always gives good results. She wants to do her best to have a successful and profitable business with which they can upgrade their living standard. She also dreams of constructing a concrete house for them.

She is very grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase necessary agricultural inputs to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Om Fuad Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Fuad. It consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 95,000 YER from AMB. 

Samira is the leader of the group. She is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. They live in their own house in Sana'a. She is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. Her husband is the sole breadwinner in the house. 

Samira doesn’t have a water tank to keep water on the roof of her house. The house needs one tank to keep the water. For this reason, Samira applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to purchase a water tank in order to keep a large amount of water for the house.

Samira looks forward to building a second floor of her house and renting it in order to earn a good amount of money.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank in order to keep a large amount of water for her house.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 57 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory like soft drinks, soap, sugar, chips, etc. to sell.

Corazon has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory like soft drinks, soap, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a 29-year-old married mother of two who works hard to provide for her family. For two years now she has run a general store in the Philippines, and also earns an income from selling pre-paid mobile loads.

Merlie has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan and is now requesting a new one  for PHP 13000 to purchase additional stocks such as sardines, noodles, soap, etc. to sell. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a 37-year-old Lebanese married mother of four children. In 1999, she started her own business by opening a small room in her house for vending high-quality clothes. She is well-known in her region for special talents in her domain. 

Today, Khawla is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to increase her merchandise with special summer collections to meet the needs of her clients. She is very proud of her business growth and hopes to expand her earnings with this loan.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with special summer collections

loans.name: Shipra

texts.en:
Shipra is a 47-year-old hardworking homemaker who lives with her husband Haren (51 years old). They have no children.  They live in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district.  Both the husband and the wife studied up to grade 10.  They live in their own house.

Shipra’s husband has been involved in a business of renting sound boxes, microphones, speakers etc. for special occasions such as marriage ceremonies, birthday parties, different meetings etc.  He has been involved in this business for the last five years and this business is the only means of income for the family.  He is well known in his locality for his honesty, simplicity and polite behavior.  He wants to get ahead with his business with the help of these qualities.  Now he wants to grow his business in order to satisfy his customers and earn additional income for the family. To do so, he needs capital, which he doesn't have.

So, Shipra has come forward and asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner), who helps the needy rural women by giving business loans.  She plans to purchase more decorative items such as sound boxes, music systems and wires to grow her business.

She hopes to keep expanding her business, which will change their present financial situation and enable her to strengthen the financial condition of her family.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sound boxes, music systems and wires

loans.name: Mily Yosseling

texts.es:
Mily Yosseling tiene 32 años de edad, vive en su propia casa que cuenta con servicios básicos de agua y luz en el Caserío de Huaquillas, una zona rural del distrito de Morropon una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de arroz y plátano, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de carne de res, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, sus clientes son sus vecinos y moradores de su comunidad.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno para posteriormente ofrecer su carne a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mily Yosseling is 32 years old and lives in her own house, in the Huaquillas village where she has basic services (water and electricity). Huaquillas is a rural area in the Morropon district and province in the Piura region of Peru's northern coast. The people here make a living in farming - particularly growing rice and plantains -, trade and cattle raising.

Mily makes a living selling red meat. She runs her business out of her home. Mily's customers' are neighbours and others living in the community.

Mily has a applied for a loan of 3000 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy bovine cattle to sell their meat to customers.

loans.use: to buy bovine cattle to sell their meat.

loans.name: Alema

texts.en:
Alema, a very young woman of only 27 years, lives with her husband and their two school-going children (one son and one daughter) in the small village of Vemtiya in the district of Jalpaiguri in a humble home.  She and her husband both have a primary education.  Their children are in different grades of primary school.

Alema's husband Yabuk, 39 years old, works as a farmer in the village to earn an income for the family's household. He has cultivatable paddy fields where he grows paddy.  He has been engaged in agricultural activities for many years.  Although Alema is a housewife who manages the household and looks after her husband and children,  she helps her husband a lot. They sell the produce in the local markets. The major part of their locality is covered with agricultural land and paddy is cultivated widely in the region.  So, they have to face competitors in the market.  The income generated from this cultivation is insufficient to support the family. 

Alema wants to increase the productivity. For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will use the loan to buy better quality seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for a good quality product.  She hopes the loan will enable her to earn additional income to provide a better education to her children and build a better, decent house for them.

She is thankful for BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Hoem

texts.en:
Hoem, 55 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. Hoem is an experienced farmer in a small rice field near her house.  She has been involving in this farming business nearly 30 years. Totally, she can make a net profit of 5 USD per day.  

Hoem would like to get a loan from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. This is her first loan. She thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Zoila Gaby

texts.es:
Zoila Gaby tiene 27 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de arroz, café y frutales, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de bocaditos, helados,que ella misma los prepara y los vende en las afuera del Colegio Nacional de su distrito, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio en su domicilio donde vende cerveza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Zoila Gaby is 27 years old and lives in the Pucará district. Pucará has a hot climate and is in the Jaén province of the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern highlands. Here the people make a living in farming, particularly growing rice, coffee and fruits.

Zoila makes a living selling snacks and ice creams that she prepares and sells outside the local state school. Zoila also has a business in her home where she sells beers. Zoila has applied for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy larger quantities of beer to sell to her customers. This will generate a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of beer to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
José Matin tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el Distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a prestar servicios como maestro de construcción civil, es contratado por Instituciones y moradores de su Distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción para su vivienda y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Martin is 38 years old and lives with his wife in the Lagunas district in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. Here the people make a living in farming, trade and cattle raising.

José makes a living as a build. He is hired by organisations and private individuals in the local area. José has applied for a loan of 3500 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy building materials for his home. This will allow him to earn a higher living for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena, a 60-year-old married mother of nine, works hard to provide for her family. For 37 years she has been running a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from a coffee shop.

Nena has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF  and is now requesting a  new one for PHP 12000 to purchase additional stocks such as biscuits, spices, noodles, etc. to sell. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as biscuits, spices, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hiralata

texts.en:
Hiralata is from Dhupguri. She is a rural woman of 47 years.  Her family consists of her husband Sashimohan and three children (two sons and one daughter). Hiralata and her husband both passed grade 12.  All her children are in college. They live in their own house.

Hiralata is a homemaker.  Her husband is the sole provider for his family and works hard to meet the household expenses and the educational expenses of her children.  He is a grocer and owns a small grocery store where he sells all the basic needs of a house like dairy, rice, oil, spices, sugar, salt, flour, snacks etc.  He established his business 15 years ago and since then, he has been providing for his family through this business.  He has good experience in this business and is well known in the neighborhood. He needs to increase his selling goods inventory to satisfy his customers' demands as well as earn additional income to strengthen the family's economy.

So Hiratala has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), who gives business loans to rural needy people. She plans to purchase more grocery items for her husband's shop.  She is aiming to grow the business and increase the profits so that she can give better living conditions to her children with good food, health and education.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a widow woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emilia is 42 years old and all of her children are in school.

Emilia has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Emilia requested a PHP 24,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dry goods like bags, slippers and other items.

Emilia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Emilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods like bags, slippers and other items.

loans.name: Maya Rani

texts.en:
Maya lives in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter).  She is 57 years old and has a primary education.  Her husband Paresh is a 58-year-old farmer who studied up to grade eight.  One of their children is a university student. They live in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo).

Maya's husband has an agricultural farm where he grows different vegetables in different seasons.  He is visionary and focused.  He has been involved in this business for the last 10 years.  He struggles hard to grow good quality vegetables to satisfy his customers.  His land is very fertile and productive.  Maya is also a hardworking and energetic lady. They need to expand their agribusiness but the main obstacle is capital.

So, Maya has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to cultivate ribbed gourd on their farmland. She wants to use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary agricultural inputs to start the cultivation. She has chosen this crop as there is a high demand for this crop in their locality.

Her goals are to strengthen their family business and economy.

She thanks her lenders for helping her by giving her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of ribbed gourds.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Phoeun, 53, lives with her husband and three children in Ba Phnum District, Prey Veng Province. She is a farmer with her own farmland near her house. Her profit from her farming business is about USD 6 per day.

This is Phoeun's first Kiva loan. Phoeun will use this loan to purchase a home solar power system to install on her roof. The purchase will allow Phoeun to gain access to clean energy to power her lights and household appliances.  

She is very thankful and hopes that she will receive this loan in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a home solar power system

loans.name: Nahiya

texts.en: Nahiya is a 31-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married and lives with her husband and two children. She’s cooperating with her husband in order to satisfy their family needs. As for her, she started her work 3 years ago when she opened a grocery store. Today, Nahiya is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase new merchandise for her grocery store in order to improve her business and, therefore, increase her productivity. Nahiya has big responsibilities to care for and this is the perfect time to better develop her work and enlarge her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol, 54 years old, lives in a rural area of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is an experienced farmer in a small rice field near her house.  She has been involved in this farming business for nearly thirty years. She can make a net profit of USD 5 per day.  

Thol would like to get a loan from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. This is the first loan for her. She thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 35 years old, married and has three children who are in school.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds.

Joan has been raising pigs for 4 years now and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Joan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds.

loans.name: Donika

texts.en: Donika's only child, her son, ended his life voluntarily due to financial struggles, leaving behind his 9-year-old daughter who is now in Donika's custody. Donika now wants to do his grave. She will very much appreciate your financial help. " I feel a burden that doesn't let me sleep at nights," said Donika.

loans.use: to complete her son's grave.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 26 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Maricel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maricel has been farming sugarcane for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati belongs to a remote village in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a very young married woman of 26 years.  Her family consists of her husband and their two sons. One of their sons reads in grade seven, and the other works and stays in a different place. Saraswati is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband studied until grade seven and could not go for higher study because of his family's poor economic resources.  After her marriage to Mohan, Saraswati is now a housewife.

Saraswati’s husband is engaged in paddy cultivation.  He grows paddy on his own farmland. The income from the business is not sufficient to meet the family's expenditures and with the daunting responsibilities, he is finding it difficult to run the household. He wants to take on additional paddy cultivation to have sustainable income and to give their son a good education.

With the aim of helping her husband with the cultivation, Saraswati is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.  She will use the loan to purchase high quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and manure to cultivate paddy. This will increase the production as well as the earnings and she will be able to fulfill the dream of a secure future for her family.  She hopes to buy new farmland from her savings in the future. She also wants to keep aside money from the profit to build a brick-built decent and better house for them.

Saraswati and her husband really thank the investors (BJS and Kiva) for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 34-year-old married mother of two who has been running her own shoes-selling shop since January 2009 to support her beloved husband in covering their family's increasing expenses.

Her business is going just fine, but she needs external additional support to increase her business capital. For this reason, Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a specially released summer collection, especially before the Holy month of Ramadan celebrations.

Fatima is working hard to open a wider shoe exhibition to attract more customers and increase her selling and develop her family's living.

loans.use: To buy a specially released summer collection of shoes

loans.name: Wajdi

texts.en: Wajdi is a 27-year-old married man from Deir El balah. He lives with his wife and one daughter in a small house. He has a sheep barn next to his house. He opened it two years ago. Wajdi sells meat and milk to the local traders. It is a very good business and the demand is high. Wajdi is seeking to take a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn. This will help him to improve his business and increase his productivity and also his income. Wajdi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 63-year-old female, who is widowed with two children.  One is attending school.  The family lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Regina sells crude salt, and has a salt pan, where she has worked for 10 years. She gets additional income from rentals. Regina began the business to meet daily family expenses. She is accessing a credit facility to buy crude salt to sell. 

Educating her children is her dream, inspite of the challenge of changes in the weather.

loans.use: to buy crude salt to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 57 years, a widow blessed with seven children between the ages of 27 years and 3 years. She does agriculture, a business she has run for the past ten years.

Eunice has requested a second loan of KES 16,000 after repaying back her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to purchase new stock of farm products.

With the profits from the loan, she will able to purchase additional dairy goats, breeding chicken and cows in order to expand her farming further.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of farm products.

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.en: After Abdulhamid finished the repayment of the installment of the second loan he took out from Kiva lenders, he applied for a third loan of 500,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase more electrical parts and materials to further expand his business. The first and second loan helped Abdulhamid very much to increase the capital of his business. The loans also improved the living standards of his family. He is very thankful for Kiva lenders for their loans. Abdulhamid hopes to be financed with this loan.

loans.use: to buy electrical parts like lamps, wires, screwdrivers and fans for his business inventory.

loans.name: Ibadaah

texts.en:
Ibadaah is 33 years old and married with two children who are two and six years old, respectively. 

She lives in the city outskirts of Makindye Division in Kampala District. She has a business selling shoes for both children and adults. She also supplements her income with money from a few rental units. In a bid to expand her income base, she requested a loan of 2,000,000 KES to add stock to her business and acquire a bigger space for her business. This will help her to beat competition and increase her income. She is grateful for the financial support rendered to her.

loans.use: To buy shoes and acquire a bigger space for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and  iron steel

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
Ruos, 56 years old, lives in a rural area of Moung Sussei District, Battambang Province, Cambodia. He is an experienced farmer with a small rice field near his house. His wife is also a farmer in the same rice field. Totally, this couple can make USD 10 per day.  

Ruos would like to get a loan from HKL. This is a second loan for him. He wants to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members. He thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 57-year-old Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and five school-aged children. She works hard to show her determination of being able to improve her family’s way of living. 

Jacqueline started her own job by opening a fish shop in 2000. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to increase her fish shop inventory. She states that the loan will certainly help her extend her job and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, Jacqueline plans to borrow more Kiva loans to further develop her work.

loans.use: to increase her fish shop inventory.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 35 years old and has two children. She is married and her two children are in school.

Rubilyn is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rubilyn has been farming sugarcane for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming business. In the future, Rubilyn would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Belle Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Belle Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Belle Marie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like thread, needles, fabrics, etc. for her tailoring shop business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Belle Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like thread, needles, fabrics, etc.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a permanent resident of a city suburb in Kawempe Division, Kampala District, five kilometers from 
Kampala City Centre. His main source of income is from rental units. 

He is a repeat client, who has taken over eleven cycles of loan facilities. These have helped to sustain him in the changing business of rentals. However, he has a challenge of some tenants' not paying on time. He has requested for a loan facility of 2,000,000 UGX to renovate his rental units and construct a perimeter wall.  He will repay this loan using rent he receives from his tenants.  

Old Martin is grateful to UGAFODE for financial assistance that has enabled him to build rental units, and this has sustained him during his old age. He also further urges the institution to reduce the interest rate on small loans.

loans.use: to renovate his rentals and construct a perimeter wall.

loans.name: Eleodora

texts.es:
Eleodora tiene 60 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el Caserío de de Carrasquillo, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y comercio de plátano actividad que realiza hace 8 años, cuenta con clientela fija en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de plátano y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Eleodora is 60 years old, and she lives with her husband and children in the village of Carrasquillo, a rural zone of the district of Buenos Aires. The people living here work in agriculture, trade, and livestock-raising. It is located within the Province of Morropón, which belongs to the Piura Region of Peru’s northern coast. 

She sells groceries, and also bananas. She has been doing this work for 8 years, and she has regular customers in the zone. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 Nuevos Soles for the purchase of fertilizers in order to maintain her banana crop, and in this way, generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers in order to maintain her banana crop.

loans.name: Bremilda

texts.es:
Bremilda tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su conviviente y sus dos menores hijos en casa propia en El Caserío de Popan Alto- Zaña, una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno en la zona donde vive y en los alrededores, en la parte posterior de su domicilio cría animales menores que lo ofrece a sus clientes que el la mayoría son los Restaurants de la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores y alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Bremilda is 44 years old. She lives with her partner and their two youngest children in their own house in El Caserío de Popan Alto-Zaña, a rural area in the district of Cayaltí. It is a community whose members work in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry. It is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú.

She makes a living raising dairy cattle in the neighborhood where she lives and its surrounding area. In her backyard, she raises small animals that she offers to her customers, the majority of which are restaurants in the area.

Bremilda has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,000 soles for the purchase of small animals and feed to fatten them, and in this way, generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small animals and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 35-year-old male who is married with four children, three of whom are attending school and living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a produce business with items like rice, millet flour, maize flour and coconuts. He has been in that business for three years and gets additional income from a motorcycle transport business. Robert is requesting a loan to buy rice, millet and maize flour to sell and his dream is to expand the business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy rice, millet and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Erick Salomón

texts.es:
Erick tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, es el ultimo de tres hermanos y gracias a ellos su padre le dio la oportunidad de estudiar ya que los otros hermanos trabajaban, está acompañado  desde hace tres años y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 


Erick trabaja en la agricultura, el lugar donde trabaja está cerca a cinco minutos de la casa, su horario de es de ocho horas 
diarias  y nadie mas le ayuda a realizar las actividades agrícolas.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar seis sacos de abono para fertilizar dos hectáreas de maíz que tiene sembradas, además invertirá en la preparación de una hectárea de tierra para sembrar ajonjolí.

Él sueña con sacar una buena cosecha para ahorrar y construir una mejor casa.
texts.en:
Erick is 26 years old and studied through the ninth grade of his basic education. He is the youngest of three siblings. Thanks to his father, Erick was given the opportunity to study while his siblings worked. He has been in a relationship for the past three years with his partner, who takes care of the household duties.

Erick works in agriculture. The place where he works is located five minutes away from his house. His work schedule every day consists of eight hours. No one else helps him with the farming activities. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy six sacks of compost so that he can fertilize two hectares of corn that he has planted. In addition, he will invest in the preparation of one hectare of land for planting sesame. His dream is to have a good harvest so that he can save and build a better house.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of compost for his corn crop and to invest in preparing one hectare of land for planting sesame.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva tiene 60 años de edad, vive en su propia casa que cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz), en el distrito de Salitral, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de temporada para damas, caballeros y niños, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio y los días de entre semana lo lleva a los caseríos cercanos a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elva is 60 years old and lives in her own home in the District of Salitral that receives public services (water and electricity). This community has a varied climated and its residents engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. The area is located in Morropon Province, which is part of the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Elva sells seasonal clothing for women, men, and children. Her business is located in her home. On weekdays, she travels to the villages that are near her district. Elva is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,000 PEN so that she can buy a large quantity of clothes that she can offer to her customers. This will enable her to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rpto. Union Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socias exitosas en su vida laboral, lo coordina la señora María Margarita de 37 años de edad, soltera, quien es propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio, este taller lo heredo de su mamá, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de rollo de tela, hilo, entretela, elástico, gabardina, dacron, satín, zipper, etc., de manera que podrá cubrir la demanda que tiene en esta temporada. Las otras integrantes son las señoras, Rosalina de 48 años de edad, quien elabora hisopos en su domicilio y luego los comercializa en los departamentos del país, Janneth de 28 años de edad, comerciante de ropa en el mercado más populosos de la capital, y Sara de 59 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of four members who are successful in their work life. The coordinator is Sra. María, who is 37 years old and single. She is the owner of a sewing workshop that is located in her home. María inherited this business from her mother. Her loan will be used to buy a roll of fabric, lining, elastic, gabardine, dacron, satin, zippers, and other supplies. This will help her to meet the seasonal demand.

The other members are as follows:
• Rosalina is 48 years old and manufactures scrub brushes in her home. She sells her products in the departments throughout the country.
• Janneth is 28 years old and works as a clothing merchant at one of the most crowded markets in the capital.
• Sara is 59 years old and owns a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy a roll of fabric, lining, elastic, gabardine, dacron, satin, zippers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 32-year-old mother of four, who has been running a convenience store for seven months in order to support her husband in covering the family's increasing needs and expenses.

Mona is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her inventory of business merchandise with special summer beverages, in addition to special holy month of Ramadan dates.

Mona is willing to develop her business in a well-managed way in order to make sure that she can expand it into a wider shop in the future and to ensure that she can provide her children with the best education and living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en:
Yegana is 35 years old  and a widow. Yegana lives with her son and parents  in the Agdash region. When she was 13, she started to learn to work in agriculture. Her parents taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than six years now. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support her family. Yegana’s  income from her business is 120 AZN. In order to increase the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. She needs an 800 AZN loan to buy fertilizers, and fruit trees.

Yegana believes in the near future her son will help her to expand the business. Since the vegetable and fruits business is profitable and a fun business, she wants the business to continue and prosper.  Her biggest wish is to offer her son an education so that they can have good careers and help their family. This is her first loan and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, and fruit trees

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Kotognogotala est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 27ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, des Pièces de pagnes, des Habits, Savon et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois. 
Tenin  est un membre du groupe Kotognogotala assise deuxième personne de droite à gauche, vendeuse de pagnes.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pièces de pagnes de différentes qualité et en quantité au marché qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse.. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kotognogotala comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Tenin  compte réaliser  95 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Kotognogotala  group is composed of women from  the Hamdallaye neighborhood of the town of Koutila who know each other well. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, children and other relatives. On the average, they are 27 years old, with at least three children.
The group members sell miscellaneous items, such as traditional colorful "pagnes" fabric, clothing, soap, etc. In order to expand their business, the group members decided to take advantage of the Soro Yiriwaso loan program for the first time.

Tenin, the second one seated from right to left, is a group member who sells traditional "pagnes" fabric. She plans to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of sets of "pagnes" in various quality grades; she will then retail them to a mixed clientele.
While other members of the Ktognogotala group plan to earn an average monthly revenue of 90,000 West African francs each during this loan cycle, Mrs. Tenin plans to earn 95,000 West African francs. In addition to paying off their loans, they use plan of their revenue to cove personal expenses and bolster their working capital. They would like to continue this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to avoid running out of merchandise stock.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 30 years old. She supports five people in her family but does not have a spouse. She has four children between the ages of nine months and nine years.

Pauline earns an income of KES 2,400 each month and has asked for her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya. With the requested loan of KES 20,000, she will purchase hair additions, hair sprays and oils, shampoo and different combs for her salon.

Pauline has successfully repaid all of her previous loans; therefore, she looks forward to expanding her current business with the profits from the requested loan, in addition to sustaining her family.

loans.use: to purchase hair additions, hair sprays and oils, shampoo, and combs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 48 years old, married, and has four children.

Virginia is involved in agriculture, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has been raising pigs for 14 years, and she has previously borrowed 27 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en:
Aynura is 37 years old and married with 2 kids. When she was 13, she started to learn to work in agriculture. Her parents taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 10 years now. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support her family. Aynura’s income from her business is 150 AZN. 

In order to improve the living conditions of her family, Aynura plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. She believes that, in the near future, her kids will help her to expand the business. Since the vegetable and fruits business is profitable and fun, she wants the business to continue and prosper. Aynura needs a 1500 AZN loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and fruit trees. Her biggest wish is to offer her children an education so that they can have good careers and help their family. This is her first loan and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and fruit trees

loans.name: Herlina

texts.en: Herlina is a 59-year-old widow who has 5 children. Yuliana, 32; Gutrida, 30; Febriani, 28; and Antonius, 24, are married. She also has an unmarried son, Jefrianus, who is 22 and a worker. Herlina has been running a business selling mango and “manisan” (slices of green mango in a sweet chili marinade) for 4 years. This “manisan” is produced from a specific variety of mango that she purchases from another region. She sells from a tiny table set on the roadside. Realizing this business is seasonal, she wishes to establish a second business selling gasoline. Unfortunately, she doesn't have the funds to begin the business, so she is asking for a loan of IDR 4,500,000. The loan will be used to purchase the gasoline, bottles, and small shelves to display the product.

loans.use: to purchase the gasoline, bottles, and small shelves to display her product

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a resident of Ntungamo municipality. She is new to borrowing. Her major business activity is mobile money. She, however, faces the challenge of little float to serve her customers because of limited resources. She has applied for a loan from UGAFODE to help her increase her float in order to meet her customers' needs and also increase her income. The profit will help her to pay tuition for her younger sister, who is in secondary school. Sarah wants her sister to study in a good school so she can attain her dream of becoming a doctor. She is hardworking and resilient. Thank you, Kiva lenders. 

Pictured is Sarah with the UGAFODE staff at the mobile money outlet.

loans.use: To increase her mobile money float

loans.name: Afzal

texts.en: Afzal is a 54-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKF from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors together with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will help her to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 9th loan cycle and has a good repayment record.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and also packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: Naheed is an expert in embroidery. She makes beautiful-looking embroidery patterns. Her clients are based in her community and from nearby areas. She earns a sufficient amount of income to bear her household expenditures. Now she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. With the loan investment she will buy cloth, beads, embroidery thread, etc., that will allow her to fill the clients' orders on time and increase her profits. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy cloth, beads, embroidery thread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase gas cylinders to meet the demands of his customers

loans.name: Maqbool

texts.en: Maqbool is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she started her business selling milk. She has been doing it for many years and has earned a reputation for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase sales, which will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a long-time client, aged 45 years, who lives in Ntungamo municipality. He is married man with 4 children. He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy mulch to help improve the status of his banana plantations. He has a challenge of little income from his plantations. Although he has many clients in the area who buy matooke (cooking bananas), his output is small. Therefore, he wants to use the loan to buy manure and standardize his agricultural output to a level that will give him good yields and money as this will help him to educate his children in better schools.

Pictured is Pius (right) with the UGAFODE credit officer at his banana plantation.

loans.use: To buy mulch and manure

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.en:
Ulviyya is a 25-year-old married woman with two little kids. Ulviyya is a hardworking woman. When she was 13, she started to learn to work in agriculture. Her parents were the ones who taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 3 years now. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support her family. Ulviyya’s income from her business is 130 AZN. In order to improve the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. Since the vegetable and fruits business is profitable and fun, she wants the business to continue and prosper.

Ulviyya needs a 1000 AZN loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and fruit trees. Her biggest wish is to offer her children an education so that they can have good careers and help their family. This is her first loan, and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and fruit trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel his home.

loans.name: Rasmiyya

texts.en: Rasmiyya is 47 years old, and the mother of five kids. Rasmiyya is a very caring mother. Her first goal is to give her children a good life. For that she is working everyday without rest. Rasmiyya raises seasonal fruits and vegetables such as corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. But she has a problem with water because every time she borrows water from a neighbor in order to water her land. Rasmiyya needs your financial support. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN. With this money she plans to buy tools and build a sluice-way. She is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for a loan.

loans.use: to buy tools and build a sluice-way

loans.name: Lila Rosa

texts.es:
Lila Rosa tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores para apoyar con los gastos familiares a su esposo, quien se desempeña como Ingeniero y es contratado por moradores de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos.
texts.en:
Lila Rosa is 30 years ola and lives in the District of Cayalti, located in Chiclayo Province, which belongs to Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Peru. It is a community of varied climate whose population works in agriculture, commerce and raises animals.

She works raising and selling small animals to help her husband with the household expenses. He works as an engineer and he is contracted by the inhabitants of the district. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 500 PEN to buy balanced feeds to fatten her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Edwin Arsecio

texts.es:
Edwin se ha dedicado a los trabajos agropecuarios y de producción animal desde hace algún tiempo.
Aprendió del oficio gracias a las enseñanzas de algunos primos que siempre se han dedicado a este trabajo.
El posee un lote de ganado al cual asiste diariamente para así tener una excelente producción bovina.
Estos animales los vende en las ferias de la localidad y en los distintos municipios de Antioquia.
Es un hombre muy emprendedor y posee gran fortaleza física para el manejo de su ganado.
El solicita un préstamo para aumentar su cantidad de animales y así darse la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio.
Siempre ha querido ser exitoso y todas sus acciones son con el fin de lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Edwin has been working in farming and raising animals for some time now. He learned this trade thanks to lessons from some cousins who do the same work.

Edwin has a herd of cattle that he looks after every day in order to attain good bovine production. Edwin sells the animals at local markets and in the different municipalities of the department of Antioquioa.

Edwin is a very enterprising man and is physically very strong so that he can look after his cattle.

Edwin is applying for this loan in order to increase his number of cattle and to have the opportunity to make money on his business.

Edwin has always wanted to be successful and everything he does, he does with the aim of achieving his goals.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Alda Lorena

texts.es:
Alda Lorena tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, reside en el Caserío Chisca Blanca,una zona rural del distrito de Morropon junto a su esposa e hijos, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales, aves de corral y animales menores desde hace varios años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de aves de corral que le permitan ofrecerlo a mayor precio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Alda Lorena is 33 years old, partnered, and lives in the village of Chisca Blanca, a rural area of Morropon district, with her partner and children. It is a community that works in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry, located in the Morropon district which belongs to the province of the same name, in the Piura region, on the north coast of Perú.

She has worked buying and selling animals, poultry and small animals, for several years. She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase poultry that will permit her to offer them for a higher price and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to fatten.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel tiene 27 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y tubérculos en el exterior del mercado de su Distrito, tambien se dedica a la crianza de cerdos en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos como papa, verduras para abastecer su negocio y una segunda parte para la compra de alimentos balanceados para cerdos.
texts.en:
María Isabel is 27 years old and lives in the District of Cayaltí, located in Chiclayo province, which belongs to Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru. The people in this community work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

María Isabel works selling vegetables and tubers outside the district market. She also raises pigs behind her house. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 PEN to buy a variety of products like potatoes and vegetables to stock her business and a second part to buy balanced feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and balanced feed to stock her business.

loans.name: Lidia Violeta

texts.es:
Lidia Violeta tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto con su esposo en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción para un corredor de su vivienda y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lidia Violeta is 34 years old, she lives with her husband in the district of Buenos Aires, a community that works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in the province of Morropon, which is part of the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.

She works selling beer, her business is located in her home, and she also raises small animals in the rear part of her home.  She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase materials to construct a corridor for her home and in this way have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix her house.

loans.name: Narsiso

texts.es:
Narsiso tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Distrito de Niepos, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de San Miguel, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesillo, desde hace varios años su esposa apoya en esta labor ordeñando el ganado lechero para posteriormente ofrecer la leche a sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una pequeña parcela de terreno que contiene pasto para alimentar a su ganado.
texts.en:
Narsiso is 45 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in the district of Niepos, a community that works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in the province of San Miguel, which is part of Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has worked making and selling farmer's cheese for a number of years; his wife helps him in this work, milking the dairy cows to then offer the milk to their neighbors and the inhabitants of their district. 

He has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a small plot of land that has pasture to feed his cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a small plot of land with pasture for cattle.

loans.name: Leopoldo De Jesús

texts.es:
Leopoldo es un joven de 19 años de edad que estudió hasta 3° año de educación Básica en la escuela de la comunidad, es el primero de cuatro hermanos motivo por el cual ya no siguió estudiando pues tenía que viajar hasta otra comunidad por lo cual se dedicó a trabajar en la agricultura junto a su papá, pues tenía que ayudar en el trabajo para sacar adelante a sus hermanos menores.


Él se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado una vez cada semana, además trabaja unas cuatro horas diarias en el cultivo de maíz.


Leopoldo necesita muchísimo de este crédito para invertir en el negocio de compra y venta de ganado, con esto estará cumpliendo la necesidad de comprar más ganado y mejorar sus ingresos.

Su sueño es hacerse un negociante en grande para poder visitar otros mercados, llevar ganado en grandes cantidades para ahorrar y construir una casa grande.
texts.en:
Leopoldo is a young man who is 19 years of age. He studied through the third grade of his basic education at a school in his community. Leopoldo is the oldest of four siblings, which is why he was not able to continue studying. He had to travel to another community so that he could work in agriculture with his father. This allowed his younger siblings to get ahead.

He buys and sells cattle each week. In addition, he works four hours a day by growing corn. Leopoldo is in great need of this loan so that he can invest in his business of buying and selling cattle. This will enable him to acquire more cattle so that he can improve his income. His dream is to become the owner of a large business so that he can visit other markets and buy cattle in large quantities. This will allow him to save and build a large house.

loans.use: to invest in his business of buying and selling cattle.

loans.name: Danny Hugo

texts.es:
Danny Hugo tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a cónyuge en el Distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, pavos y pollos desde hace 01 año, también se desempeña como jornalero agrícola por su zona de residencia y alrededores.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores y alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos que le permitirán tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Danny Hugo is 45 years old and lives with his wife in the District of Lagunas, a community that has a varied climate. The residents engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Danny has been raising and selling small animals such as ducks, turkeys, and chickens for one year. He also works as a farm laborer in his home district and in the surrounding areas. Danny is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN in order to buy small animals and balanced feed for fattening them. This will allow him to have better production so that he can offer animals to his customers.

loans.use: to buy small animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa tiene 66 años de edad y se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella es una mujer visionaria quien con mucho esfuerzo va saliendo a delante. Teresa solicita este crédito a FUSAI puesto que actualmente no cuenta con energía eléctrica en su vivienda y con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de proceder a instalar el servicio que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en:
Teresa is 66 years old and has been providing housekeeping services for a long time. She is a visionary woman who has the strong desire to move forward.

Teresa is requesting this loan from FUSAI since she currently does not receive electricity in her home. In order to improve her living conditions, she decided to proceed with installing this service that she lacks at the moment.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of electricity service in her home.

loans.name: Vanessa De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Vanessa de los Milagros tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto con su conviviente y menor hijo en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Vanessa de los Milagros is 28 years old and lives with her partner and young child in the district of Morropon, a community that works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in the province of the same name, which belongs to Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

She works selling clothing for women, men, and children; her business is located in her home. She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase a greater quantity of clothing to offer her customers and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fall/winter clothing for male and female customers.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
Germán tiene 45 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, junto con su cónyuge y sus cinco menores hijos de 20, 19, 18, 10, 5 en el Caserío Lamparan, una zona rural del Distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado caprino, las compras lo realiza en su Caserío y las ventas a clientes del Caserío Las Juntas, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de ganado caprino para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Germán is 45 years old, and lives in his own house made of rustic materials, with his spouse and five children who are minors, ages 20, 19, 18, 10 and 5 in the village of Lamparan, a rural area in Pomahuaca District, whose population works in agriculture, trade and raising livestock, located in Jaén province that belongs to Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works raising and selling goats. He makes the purchases in his village and sells them to customers in the village of Las Juntas. He has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a greater number of goats to offer his customers.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Wilson Alexander

texts.es:
Wilson trabaja de manera independiente como productor agropecuario prestando sus servicios en las diferentes fincas del municipio de El Santuario.
En la región es muy conocido por su buen humor y simpatía, sin quitarle crédito a su buen trabajo y forma de servir.
Vive en una humilde finca junto con sus padres por los que actualmente responde.
Es un hombre responsable y muy emprendedor.
El transporte entre las fincas en muchas ocasiones es muy difícil por la disponibilidad horaria de las rutas de transporte, por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de una motocicleta que le permita transportarse rápida y cómodamente entre sus distintos sitios de trabajo.
Hasta el momento ésta es su única dificultad y espera poder superarla pronto ya que es algo que considera que le quita demasiado tiempo.
texts.en:
Wilson works independently as a farmer offering his services to different farms in the municipality of El Santuario.

In this region, he is well-known for his good humor and friendliness, without discounting his good work and way of serving.

He lives on a humble farm with his parents who currently own it. 

He is a responsible and very enterprising man. 

Transportation between farms is often very difficult due to the available schedule of the transportation routes.  For this reason he asks for a loan to purchase a motorcycle that will permit him to travel quickly and comfortably among his various workplaces.

Up to now, this has been his only difficulty and he hopes to be able to overcome it soon since it is something that he thinks takes too much of his time.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and tools.

loans.name: Juana Elvira

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en Santiago junto a su familia.
Tiene 2 hijos por quienes siempre ha luchado a pesar de ser madre soltera y no tener el apoyo de nadie, para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Desde hace 14 años trabaja como Obrera en un Fundo Agrícola de la zona, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honrada y con muchos deseos de superación.
Juana está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá remodelar su vivienda como pintarrajear las paredes y arreglar el techo para que de así su familia pueda sentirse cómoda y segura en la vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana is an enterprising woman.  She is 34 years old, a single mother and lives in Santiago with her family.

She has 2 children for whom she always has fought, despite being a single mother and without anyone's support, to offer them a better quality of life.

Since she was 14 years old, she has worked as a worker on a large farm in the area, which is going very well for her since she is a very responsible, hard-working, and honest person with a strong desire to improve herself.

Juana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support they have offered her, she will be able to remodel her home such as plastering the walls and fixing the roof so that her family can feel comfortable and safe in their home.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home (plaster the walls and fix the roof).

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ceviche, tortitas entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus productos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 50 years old, partnered, and lives in the district of Cayaltí, a community that works in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry, located in Chiclayo province that is part of Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She works selling ceviche and pancakes among others. Her business is located in her home and she has asked Epyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase the supplies to prepare these products and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare the food that she sells.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique tiene 52 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto con su conyugue y sus cuatro menores hijos de 18,14,11,6 años de edad de los cuales los dos primeros cursa secundaria y los otros primaria en Colegio Nacional en el Caserío de Cañarís, una zona rural en el distrito de Cañarís, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, ubicado en el Caserío Sondor - Pucara, con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos lo utilizara en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique is 52 years old, and he lives in his own house, which is made of rustic materials, with his spouse and four young children, ages 18, 14, 11, and 6.  The two oldest are in secondary school, and the others are in primary school in the National School in the small village of Cañarís, which is a rural zone in the district of Cañarís.  The people here work in agriculture, trade, and livestock-raising. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region of Peru’s northern coast.

He devotes himself to agriculture, specifically, coffee growing, in the small village of Sondor-Pucara, and he has 4 years’ experience. He has requested a loan of 1,500 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa. It is for the purchase of compost that he will use for farming, the application and incorporation of phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and the payment of labor for his harvest.

In this way, he would aid both the physiological and morphological improvement of his crop, as well as have a timely harvest. Thus, he will have a greater production and a better quality product, and therefore, he will not have any problems selling it.

loans.use: to purchase compost and to pay workers for maintaining his coffee crop.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Chichicastenango, departamento de El Quiché, tiene 4 hijos, el primero tiene 15 años de edad estudia primer grado básico, el segundo tiene trece años estudia sexto grado primaria, el tercero tiene 12 años de edad estudia quinto grado primaria y el cuarto tiene 10 años de edad y estudia cuarto grado primaria, Tomas se dedica a comprar y a vender verduras, tiene ya 17 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, lo aprendió de sus papás ya que desde pequeño ayudaba a sus papás, además tiene una pequeña parcela de árboles frutales, Tomas necesita un crédito por un monto de Q. 5,000.00 para invertir en la compra y venta de verduras (compra y vende papas, zanahoria, güisquil, elote y otros), el sueño de Tomas es tener un local dentro del mercado porque actualmente vende en la calle.
texts.en:
Tomas is 40 years old, lives in the municipality of Chichicastenango, in the department of El Quiché, and has 4 children, the first is 15 years old and 
is in the first year of secondary school, the second is 13 years old and is a sixth grade student, the third is 12 years old and is in the fifth grade, and the fourth is 10 years old and is in the fourth grade. Tomas works buying and selling vegetables, and has been working in this field for 17 years. He learned it from his parents since he helped his parents from a young age; in addition, he has a small plot of fruit trees. Tomas needs a loan for the amount of Q. 5,000.00 to invest in the purchase and sale of vegetables (he purchases and sells potatoes, carrots, chayote squash, corn, and others). Tomas's dream is to have a stall in the market because at the moment he sells in the street.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is 36 years old and married. She has been in the beauty parlor business for the past 10 years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this reason, she wants to purchase packs of combs, makeup kits, lipsticks, lotions and cleansers in large quantities so she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation.  She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, makeup kits, lipsticks, lotions and cleansers in large quantities

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es: Tomás tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 5 hijos; 2 de ellos lo ayuda en su taller de telar y 3 estudian, Tomás se dedica a la elaboración de cortes típicos que utilizan las mujeres de la comunidad, le deja buena ganancia y tiene mucha demanda ya que es la vestimenta diaria de la personas, Tomás tiene 6 años de estar trabajando en su taller, además se dedica a comprar y a vender verduras, Tomás necesita un crédito por un monto de Q. 9,000.00 para comprar materia prima (hilos de todos los colores) para la elaboración de cortes típicos, Tomás es una persona muy responsable ya quiere darles una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Tomás is 43 years old, lives in the municipality of Sololá in the department of Sololá and has 5 children.  Two of them help him in his weaving shop and three are students. Tomás works making cortes (traditional woven skirts) that the women of the community wear.  It gives him a good profit and is in high demand since it is the daily clothing of the people. Tomás has worked in his workshop for 6 years; he also works buying and selling vegetables. Tomás needs a loan for the amount of Q. 9,000.00 to purchase raw materials (yarn of all colors) to make the cortes.  Tomás is a very responsible person since he wants to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to make cortes (traditional Guatemalan woven skirts).

loans.name: Betty Alicia

texts.es:
Betty Alicia tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil casado tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el Distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicad en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.
