Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, desde hace varios años en el negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Betty Alicia is 44 years old, married and has 2 children.  She lives with her family in Oyotún district, a rural area where people work in farming, trade and animal husbandry, located in Chiclayo province which is part of Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

She has worked selling groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, legumes for several years in her business.  She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase a variety of products to offer her customers and in this way grow her business and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to meet up with the increasing demands. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y ceviche desde hace siete años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos como variedad de pescados y cerveza para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is 34 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Nueva Arica District, a community with a varied climate whose population works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in Chiclayo province, which is part of Lmbayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.

She has worked selling beer and ceviche for the past seven years. Her business is located in the rear part of her home; she has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase supplies such as a variety of fish and beer to offer her customers and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and a variety of fish for preparation.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to have more customers time after time. For this reason, she requires hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities so she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation.  She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Xalida

texts.en:
Xalida is a 57-year-old married woman with three children. Her main source of income is agriculture (gardening). Xalida grows fruit trees (pear, peach, apple, pomegranate, cherry and so on) and sells the fruit at the local bazaar. She has 30 years of experience in gardening and gets 120 AZN for this. 

In Azerbaijan, the demand for fruit is very high. During the whole year, people buy fruit for everyday use. They eat fruit fresh or prepare them in different tasty and sweet things.

This is Xalida's first loan, and it is for 1,500 AZN. Unfortunately, her income from gardening and her pension isn’t enough to cover life's demands. That’s why she needs more money. Xalida plans to use this money for her children’s education and for family maintenance.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education and family maintenance

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single lady and a retailer. She has two children, ages 11 and 3 years old. Jane buys mattresses to sell to her customers. She has done this business for the past year. She has requested a loan of 27,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase small mattresses for resale.

Jane earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. Jane will be able to reinvest the profits in her business and buy surplus mattresses for resale at a profit.

loans.use: to expand her mattress business

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 25 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el Caserío Las Delicias, una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de albañilería, desde hace años, cuenta con clientela que lo contrata para construcción de viviendas, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan ofrecerlo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 25 years old and lives in a house he owns in the Las Delicias hamlet, a rural area of the district of Oyotún. This community makes a living in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle and it is located in the province of Chiclayo, which is part of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He has made a living by providing stonemason services for many years. He has customers who hire him for the construction of homes. He has asked for a loan of 500 Peruvian nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy construction materials so he can offer them to his customers.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to offer to his customers.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is an old client, 45 years old, and a resident of central ward. He is a married man with four children and he applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more stock of agricultural drugs. Being a sorghum grower, he wants to use his money to hire laborers to clear the land and plant more sorghum. He has a challenge of limited income from his business, yet there is a ready market of many clients in the area who make locally processed beer known as omuramba. So he wants to increase the output, which will increase his income and improve his standard of living in the long run. This will help his family members (children and dependents) to acquire a better education since he is the caretaker of the whole family.

loans.use: To hire laborers to clear the land and plant sorghum

loans.name: Dd Gorgeous Group

texts.en:
Soyayuo is the featured borrower of DD Gorgeous group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work as housekeepers in order to develop their family's living.

Soyayuo is a 41-year-old married mother of three who works hard as a housekeeper to help her beloved family to cover and develop their living needs. 
She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to send money to her beloved family in the Philippines to cover their increasing living needs. She hopes that one day she can unite back with them and find the best financial stability to cover most of their living needs.

Soyayuo is the first lady standing at the far right side of the picture. The other group members are Lira, the second lady from the right; Vilma, the lady at the center of the picture; Gelle, the second from the left; and Lerio, the first from the left.

loans.use: To send money to her beloved family in the Philippines to cover their living needs.

loans.name: Nancy Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy es una socia fundadora del grupo de crédito El Cisne, vive por la parroquia del Valle que se encuentra situada al suroeste de la Ciudad de Cuenca, siendo famosa por su producción de maíz, papas, etc., su atractivo turístico es la laguna de Cochapamba que se encuentran llena de totoras (planta), la colina de Tasqui que permite una hermosa vista de la parroquia y de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy cálida y amable. 
La Señora. Nancy  tiene39 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 21, 20, 10 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija esa casada y vive  independiente, su segunda hija pasa en casa ayudando a los quehaceres, sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo se dedica a la carpintería, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Nancy comercializa una gran variedad de animales como pollos, cuyes y cerdos, trabaja solo días de feria. También se dedica a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa y también vende. El dinero es para la compra de pollos y cuyes. Su meta es continuar creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a founding member of the El Cisne loan group. She lives in the El Valle parish, which is located to the southwest of the city of Cuenca and is famous for its production of corn, potatoes, etc. Its tourist attractions are the lake of Cochapamba, which is full of totora (the plant), and the Tasqui hill, which allows for a beautiful view from the parish and city of Cuenca. Its people are very warm and friendly.

Nancy is 39 years old, is married and has conceived four children as the fruit of her marital union, ages 21, 20, 10 and 8. Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently and her second daughter is at home helping with the chores. Her last two children are studying in a local school and her husband makes a living in carpentry. They own the house they live in.

Nancy sells a great variety of animals like chickens, guinea pigs and pigs. She only works on market days. She also makes a living in agriculture, which is for her household's consumption and also for sale. The money is for the purchase of chickens and guinea pigs. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Abarobyi Cb Group

texts.en: Clementine is 43 years old. She is married with five children. Clementine is the group leader of "Abarobyi", which means "The Fishers" in English. The members have different business types, but they all have the same aim: to make a better living for themselves and their communities. With this loan, Clementine will buy more rice and cooking oil for sale. Clementine plans to reinvest the profits in the business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 46-year-old married man with six children between the ages of three and 18. Four of them are currently attending school. He lives in the Hoima district in Western Uganda.

Christopher raises cattle, but he also grows crops like maize and beans to supplement his income from cattle keeping. He has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 Uganda shillings to buy bulls for fattening so that he can sell them at a profit.

Christopher's major challenges are drought and animal diseases. His dream is to acquire more land so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase bulls for rearing

loans.name: José Bernardo

texts.es:
José tiene 45 años de edad, solo estudio 1° grado en la escuela debido a que sus padres no se interesaron en que estudiara, hoy está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, todos los hijos están estudiando y todos dependen de José.


José se dedica a la agricultura, trabaja casi todo el día en el campo ya que le queda cerca de su casa, se ha dedicado a esto debido a su escaso nivel académico lo cual le impide conseguir un mejor trabajo.


Él solicita este crédito para pagar la mano de obra que le ayudará en la preparación de dos hectáreas de tierra para sembrar ajonjolí, de esta forma se le estaría ayudando con el crédito para que pueda llevar a cabo sus planes..

Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen la escuela y después continúen para hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
José is 45 years old and only completed the first grade because his parents had no interest in providing for his studies. Today he is in a relationship and his partner takes care of the household duties. All of his children are studying and dependent on him.

José is devoted to agriculture. He works almost every day in a field located near his house. José engages in this type of work because his lack of education prevents him from securing a better job. He is requesting this loan so that he can pay for labor. José needs assistance in preparing two hectares of land for planting sesame. The support he is receiving with this loan will enable him to carry out his plans. His dream is to see his children finish school so that they can go on to become professionals.

loans.use: to hire labor for preparing two hectares of land for planting sesame.

loans.name: Angel Ernesto

texts.es: Angel tiene 24 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a su compañera de vida. Angel trabaja como albañil desde hace cinco años y es aí como mantiene la economía del hogar. Angel ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda y también desea instalar la energía eléctrica en su vivienda. Espera poder contar con el financiamiento y así proceder lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Angel is 24 years old and resides in his own home along with his life companion. He has been working as a bricklayer for five years in order to sustain his household finances.

Angel decided to request this loan from FUSAI so that he could invest in repairs to the roof of his house and also have electricity installed in his home. He hopes to receive this loan so that he can proceed as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy materials for repairing the roof of his house and to pay for the installation of electricity service.

loans.name: América Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora. América forma parte del grupo de crédito El Cisne, vive por la parroquia del Valle que se encuentra situada al suroeste de la Ciudad de Cuenca, siendo famosa por su producción de maíz, papas, etc., su atractivo turístico es la laguna de Cochapamba que se encuentran llenas de totoras (planta), la colina de Tasqui que permite una hermosa vista de la parroquia y de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy cálida y amable. 
La Señora América tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en escuela, su esposo es albañil, la casa en la que vive es propia
Doña América pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos y familia, pero para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, actividad que la realiza desde niña ya que sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en esta labor, le gusta mucho este trabajo porque le da la oportunidad de ser una persona libre, no tiene jefes y esta todo el tiempo pendiente de su familia. Su crédito anterior  invirtió en la compra de materiales de construcción al igual que su nuevo crédito, ya que su meta y lo que más desea es terminar su casa para vivir a lado de su familia. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por el apoyo que recibe de todas sus integrantes.
texts.en:
América is part of the El Cisne loan group. She lives in the El Valle parish, which is located to the southwest of the city of Cuenca and is famous for its production of corn, potatoes, etc. Its tourist attractions are the lake of Cochapamba, which is full of totora (the plant), and the Tasqui hill, which allows for a beautiful view of the parish and city of Cuenca. Its people are very warm and friendly.

América is 31 years old, is married and has had three children as the fruit of her marital union, ages 13, 10 and 6. Her oldest daughter studies at the high school and her last two children study at the primary school. Her husband is a stonemason and they live in their own house.

América stays home to care for her children and family, but to help her husband with the household expenses she makes a living by raising animals and in agriculture, an activity she has done since she was a girl, as her parents taught her to do this work. She likes this work a lot because it gives her the opportunity to be a free person; she doesn't have any bosses and is always focused on her family. 

She invested her previous loan in buying construction materials and will do the same with her new loan, as her goal and what she most desires is to finish her house to live near her family. Her loan group likes the support that all of its members receive.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Erondina

texts.es: ERONDINA: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 52 años de edad, casada con 9 hijos: 6 son mayores de edad y 3 que se encuentran estudiando la secundaria. Su esposo trabaja como vigilante en una institución del gobierno central. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos desde hace más de una década que estableció su negocio de alquiler de cuartos de tambo de madera, cobrando una mensualidad de C$ 500 (Quinientos Córdobas Netos). Solicita su primer financiamiento para mejorar el techo de uno de los cuartos y mejorar las condiciones de infraestructura a sus inquilinos, para que se sientan cómodos. Su sueño es construir su casa de concreto e instalarle cerámica.
texts.en: Erondina is from Puerto Cabezas, is 52 years old and is married with nine children: six are adults and three are studying in secondary school. Her husband works as a security guard at an institution of the central government. With the objective of having her own source of income, she started her business renting rooms in wooden cabins more than a decade ago, charging C$500 (five hundred Nicaraguan córdobas) per month. She is asking for her first loan to improve the roof of one of the rooms and to improve the conditions of the infrastructure for her renters so that they feel more comfortable. Her dream is to build her house from concrete and to install ceramic.

loans.use: to improve the roof of one of the rooms she rents

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 27-year-old single man. Tareq lives with his family in Haja, Yemen. He studied until secondary school, but he couldn't complete his studies. Tareq accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a taxi transport. He has been in this business for many years. He works as a driver of the taxi. Unfortunately, most of what he earns from this business goes to the repair of the taxi. He spends most of his money and time in repair and maintenance of the taxi. So, his taxi needs repairing, but Tareq doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, he applied for a Youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to buy spare parts for the taxi. These new spare parts will help him save a lot of money.

Tareq's vision is to purchase another taxi transport and rent it.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the taxi.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 43-year-old married man with eight children. He lives with his family in their own house in Haja, Yemen. He is an employee in the public sector with a very low salary. He is a talented and responsible professional man. He has a high determination inside himself to go ahead. The salary that he receives from his job is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. For this reason, Mohammed decided to purchase a motorcycle in order to improve the condition of his family and to save money for his children. For this reason, Mohammed is requesting a loan of 230,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a motorcycle for transportation that will help him to improve the condition of his family. 

Mohammed hopes to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transportation that will help him improve the condition of his family.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a new client and a resident of rural Uganda. He is aged 45 years old. He deals in agriculture and wants to improve it so that he can increase his income but he is lacking enough money to buy organic manure and hire labor. That’s why he has come to UGAFODE for loan hoping that it can change his output by increasing yields so that he will be able to harvest more matooke (bananas).  He applied for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 and is optimistic that this will change his income and status. He is grateful that Kiva lenders are willing to support his dream of alleviating the poverty of his household. He is hardworking.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is a 34-year-old married man. He has one daughter. He has grown fruit trees (apple, peach, etc.) and vegetables in a big greenhouse and sold them at the bazaar for 5 years. Ramin’s monthly income is 95 AZN. This is not enough to cover his life costs and help his parents.

Azeri people like eating tasty fruit cakes (apple cake, peach cake) and fruit jam. They prepare various kinds of sweet jam from ancient times by old traditional recipes. These old recipes make jam stay useful, fresh and tasty for a long time. Azerbaijan people like eating jam and  drinking hot flavored tea.
 
Ramin applied for a 600 AZN loan from Aqroinvest Credit Union and this is his first loan. He wants to repair the greenhouse and buy effective fertilizers for his plants. Ramin is a very responsible and reliable person.

loans.use: to repair the greenhouse and buy effective fertilizers for plants.

loans.name: Mahira

texts.en:
Mahira is a 38-year-old married woman with a daughter and a son. Her husband is a driver. Mahira has been earning money from farming for 12 years and has gained good skills. She raises crops and seasonal fruit trees (quince, persimmon, etc.). Her monthly income is 100 AZN. She gets additional income bringing up hens and cocks.
 
Quince and persimmon are very delicious and useful fruits, especially fresh. People like these fruits because of their taste and use them in preparing jams and juice. 

Mahira applied for a 1000 AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizers and garden tools. She plans to increase her income and be able to repair her house in the future and make it better. Mahira awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 41-year-old married man with four children, three of whom are currently attending school. He lives in Kyangwali in Western Uganda.

Emmanuel has been a cattle trader since 2009. This is his main business, but he also carries out farming on the side, growing crops such as maize and beans.

He approached UGAFODE for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more cattle, which will allow him to earn even greater profits.

Emmanuel describes his major challenge as poor road networks which affect his ability to transport his cattle. His plans for the future are to expand his business and educate all his children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus is a 42-year-old married man with three children. They are residents of Kyangwali in Western Uganda. Deus is a businessman who deals in beverages, mainly sodas, juices, beer and wines. He also operates a bar and lodge. He approached UGAFODE for a loan of 4,000,000 to purchase stock for his business so that he can earn more profits.

Deus describes his major challenges as seasonality in his business and competition from other business people who sell similar products. His dreams are to acquire more land and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase beverages for resale.

loans.name: Gulcahan

texts.en:
Gulcahan is a 54-year-old widow with a daughter and two sons. She raises vegetables and her elder son helps her in this. Then she sells them at the local bazaar and gets 150 AZN monthly for this. She has 21 years experience in this work.
 
Azerbaijan cuisine has lots of recipes of delicious dishes. People buy vegetables to prepare such dishes as dolma, badimjhan dolmasi, qovurma, sogan dolmasi, basdirma and so on. That’s why people want vegetables (potatoes, tomatoes, onions, greens, eggplant).

The situation of Gulcahan is very hard. She has to support her children and provide them with a bright future. She applied for 1,000 AZN loan in order to buy more fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana lives in Gandzaqar village of Tavush region. She is a widow and lives alone. She works at Gandzaqar Art School. Because of a low salary Tatyana has always been forced to look for other revenue sources. Particularly, she has been engaged in farming for a long time. She cultivates potatoes, corn and other types of grains. In order to sustain her agribusiness and grow it further, Tatyana now wants to engage in animal breeding. She has applied for a loan of USD 1,000 to implement her plans. The requested loan will be used to buy 2 pigs and animal feed. There is nobody else who can help Tatyana. That is why she really hopes to receive support from the lenders. Let's help Tatyana expand her agribusiness and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase livestock (2 pigs) and animal feed.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz is 54 years old. She is married and has two daughters and two sons. Her husband earns money for the family working as a laborer. Solmaz  has been working as a farmer for 20 years. She raises fruits (pears, apples, cherries and apricots) and vegetables (greens, green onions, cucumbers, potatoes,  etc.) and then sells at the local bazaar.
 
Azerbaijan cuisine is very rich and various. People prepare different national dishes from vegetables with meat. They cook basdirma, bughlama, doghramajh, dovgha, etc. They also like fresh fruits for dessert or prepare different fruit pies, cakes and kinds of juice for holidays, parties and ordinary life.

Though Solmaz is old, she is still a very hardworking woman. She loves her job and wants to expand it. She applied for 1,000 AZN in order to buy new fertilizers and build a small greenhouse for her garden. She knows that this will protect her harvest and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and build a small greenhouse for her garden.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 19-year-old single young man from Nablus city.  He lives with the family in a very simple house. 

Eyad works with his father in his blacksmith workshop. After few years of work, he has good experience in this field.

Eyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new machine for his blacksmith workshop. By taking this loan, Eyad will be able to increase his productivity and also the quality of his work.

Eyad appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for his blacksmith workshop.

loans.name: Amaal

texts.en:
Amaal is a 59-year-old married woman from Bethlehem city. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter; all of them are university students. 

Amaal's husband has a wheat mill. It is a good business, and the demand is high. Amaal started her own business two years ago, making candles. She sells them in Bethlehem churches.

Amaal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy raw materials for making candles. This will increase her productivity and also her income.

Amaal was photographed in her workshop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making candles

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married man from Gaza. He is the father of one son and one daughter. 

Nine years ago, Ali opened his barber shop in the city. It is a very good business, and the income is high. He would like to improve his business and expand it. 

Ali took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a steam machine for cleaning the skin. By taking this loan, Ali will be able to improve his business and attract more clients for his barber shop. 

Ali appears in the photo in his shop.

loans.use: to buy a steam machine for cleaning the skin.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is a 27-year-old married man from Khan Younis. He lives with his wife and one small child in a simple house. Firas works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family’s needs. 

Firas would like to improve his income and the family’s living conditions. He decided to work in transferring goods using a rickshaw.

Firas took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for his business. By taking this loan, Firas will be able to start transferring goods to the local traders. This will increase the family’s income and also improve their living conditions.

Firas appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for his stall to resell.

loans.name: Simbilisio

texts.en:
Simbilisio is a 27-year-old man. He is married with one child. He operates a retail shop for twelve hours a day. He has been in that business for three years and has additional income from motorcycle transport. 

Simbilisio has asked for a loan to buy rice, salt, sugar, soap, and other merchandise to sell. Like other people dealing in retail, he is also affected by price fluctuations, yet he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, salt, sugar, soap, and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de Diciembre está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con lo cual quieren conocer la situación de vida de cada una.
Bernardina es parte de este grupo, ella es una persona que se destaca por su lucha diaria, ya que a través de ese trabajo ayuda a su familia, y tiene los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de la casa. Ella se dedica a hacer comidas varias, y comenta que se ha hecho ya de mucha clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser tomate, lechuga, locote, papa, cebolla, carne y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank "8 de Diciembre" is in its first loan cycle.  They take part in the poverty elimination program and want to know about each member's situation.

Bernardina is a member of the group and is someone who stands out because of her daily struggle.  Through her work she helps her family and earns income to cover household necessities.  She makes and sells different kinds of foods and says she has many customers.

The loan she is requesting is to buy food ingredients such as tomato, lettuce, sweet peppers, potatoes, onions, meat and other items.  She is grateful for this opportunity which will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, lettuce, sweet peppers, potatoes, onions, meat and other items.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es: Cristina del Carmen: Es una mujer emprendedora de 70 años de edad. Desde hace muchos años estableció su pequeña pulpería en su vivienda. Solicita financiamiento para incrementar su inventario: granos básicos, huevos, chiverías, entre otros productos no perecederos. Su sueño es vender embutidos, pollo y leche.
texts.en: Cristina del Carmen: She’s a 70-year-old entrepreneur woman. It has been some years since she opened her small grocery store in her home. She is requesting a loan to increment her inventory: dry grains, eggs, and dairy products, among other non-perishable products. Her dream is to sell meat, poultry, and milk.

loans.use: to increment her inventory: dry grains, eggs, dairy products, among other non-perishables.

loans.name: Carla Viviana

texts.es:
Carla es una joven emprendedora, tiene 23 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Tiene 1 hijo quien es su mayor orgullo y por quien trabaja incansablemente para poder brindarle un mejor futuro.
 Desde hace casi 1 año trabaja como personal de limpieza en una empresa y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable, trabajadora, honesta y dedicada a su labor.
Carla está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá hacer arreglos a su casa como pintarrajear las paredes, y comprar un juego de sala, de esta manera su familia sentirá mayor comodidad y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida. Así seguirá esforzándose para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Carla is an entrepreneurial young woman. She is 23 years old and lives with her family. She has one son who is her biggest pride and for whom she works tirelessly to be able to provide a better future.

She has worked for almost one year in the cleaning team at a company. She does very well because she is responsible, hard working, honest and dedicated to her work.

Carla is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she will be able to make repairs to her home, such as painting the wall, and to buy a living room furniture set. This way, her family will feel more comfortable and will improve its quality of life. Carla will continue to make an effort to get her family ahead in life.

loans.use: to fix her home.

loans.name: Donilda

texts.es: Donilda: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 30 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos, es una mujer luchadora. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos desde hace 9 años vende de manera ambulante cosméticos, perfumes y otros productos de belleza por catálogo. Gracias a los créditos anteriores y a las ganancias percibidas de su pequeño negocio le han permitido comprar materiales de construcción para ir construyendo poco a poco su vivienda de concreto. Solicita financiamiento para comprar productos: cremas, perfumes, maquillaje, pinturas de uñas entre otros productos en Managua y venderlos a precios accesibles en Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es establecer una pulpería en su vivienda
texts.en:
Donilda is from Puerto Cabezas.  She is 30 years old, married, has four children and is a hard-working woman.  In order to earn her own income, nine years ago she started selling cosmetics, perfumes and other beauty products by catalogue.  Thanks to her previous loans and the earnings from her small business she was able to buy construction materials to build a concrete house littly by little.  

The loan she is requesting now is to buy creams, perfumes, make up, nail polish and other products in Managua, which she will sell at good prices in Puerto Cabezas.  Her dream is to open a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: To buy products such as creams, perfumes, make-up, nail polish and other products in Managua.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, sigue trabajando en el reciclaje como lo venia haciendo desde hace ya un tiempo. Comenta que gracias a su préstamo anterior pudo comprar insumos para la despensa que también tienen.
Hoy el Sr. Francisco pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de materiales reciclados, como ser cartones, plásticos, hierros, etc., para poder revender y de esa forma tener un ingreso mayor.
texts.en:
Francisco is a very hard-working, determined person who continues in recycling as he has been doing for some time now.  He says that thanks to the previous loan he was able to buy supplies for the store he also runs.

Now Francisco is requesting a loan to buy recycling materials such as cardboard, plastic, iron, etc. to resell and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy cardboard, plastic, iron, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing, wax cotton and lace to expand her business.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Kuña Aty, es un grupo nuevo, está en su primer ciclo, están también dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Virginia quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo quiere decir que debe esforzarse un poco más, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de frutas que hace está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayuda a su familia. Comenta que a través de las capacitaciones y su arduo trabajo viene mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas varias, como ser manzanas, bananas, naranjas y demás frutas para poder seguir trabajando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo de seguir luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
This group is called Kuña Aty.  It is new and in its first loan cycle, and also participating in the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Virginia who showed a level one on her last poverty level questionnaire, which means she should work a little more.  Through her effort and continued work selling fruit she is struggling to improve her living conditions and help her family.  Through training and hard work she says her situation is improving.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a variety of fruits such as apples, bananas, oranges and other fruit so she can continue her work.  She is grateful for this opportunity so the group can continue its struggle to improve.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruits to sell, such as apples, bananas, oranges and other fruit.

loans.name: Musazajijuka Group

texts.en: Peace is a group leader of Musazajijuka which means Knowledgeable in English. The group members have different business types and they have been in business for almost ten years. They have a dream of creating a strong saving group which in future will be having shares in different markets. Peace is 32 years old and married with five children. She sells foodstuffs such as beans and sorghum. She will use her portion of the loan to buy more foodstuffs such as beans and sorghum. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. Peace puts up her hand as a sign of identification from other group members.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 40-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He sells second-hand clothes and has been in that business since 2004. He began the business to generate income for his family. He dreams of expanding his business and buying a motorcycle to help him go to different markets with ease. However, he is faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital. John intends to use the loan to buy second-hand clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Scarleth Ivania

texts.es: Scarleth: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, madre soltera de 2  menores de edad, trabaja de manera formal en una institución del gobierno central. Desde hace 31 años vive en casa de sus padres. Con el objetivo de legalizar los documentos del terreno y establecer una cerca solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales: alambre de púa, postes de madera, clavos, grapas y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener su propia vivienda y establecer un negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Scarleth is from Puerto Cabezas.  She is a single mother of two minor children and works for a central government institution.  For 31 years she has lived in her parents's house.  In order to legalize land documents and put up a fence she is requesting a loan to buy materials such as barbed wire, wood, nails and staples, as well as hire workers.  Her dream is to have her own house and establish a business to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy materials such as barbed wire, wood posts, nails and staples and to hire workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, paste, biscuits and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene, a 36-year-old married female with four children, lives in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a motorcycle transport business which she has operated since 2000, and she has a brick laying business as a source of additional income. Irene dreams of educating her children. She is a hardworking woman although faced with a challenge of competition and accidents on the road. She intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, paste, biscuits and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Erina

texts.en: Erina is 38 years old and married with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She sells secondhand clothes and carries out bricklaying as an additional income source. She began the business to generate income for her family. She dreams of expanding her business and educating her children. However, she faces a challenge of competition and changes in customers' fashions and preferences. Erina intends to use the loan to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, paste, biscuits and drinks for resale

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en:
Maleyka is 36 years old. She lost her husband and lives alone with her kids. Now she is the only person who can take care of her family. Maleyka has been growing seasonal fruit trees (apples, pears, etc.) for years and has good skills in this field. Her monthly salary is 100 AZN.

Azerbaijan people like fresh fruits and have a high demand for them, especially refugees who can’t buy fresh fruits when they need to because of the prices. That’s why Maleyka tries to sell her harvest as cheaply as possible. She knows what a hard life refugees have.

Unfortunately, Maleyka’s income is very low to cover her family’s living costs. Seasonal fruits don’t bring as much earnings as needed. She applied for 1100 AZN in order to supply seeds, grow and sell other kinds of fruits. She hopes that this is a good way to increase her income. Let’s help Maleyka and her family. This is going to be her second loan. Maleyka awaits your support.

loans.use: to supply seeds, grow and sell other kinds of fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Tembiapora Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 25 mujeres inspiradas en una mejor y buena calidad de vida, no solo para ellas, sino también para sus hijos. Son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, donde se destaca de ellas la Sra. Veronica que se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité que mediante eso ella pudo emprender una nueva actividad.
Veronica elabora productos de limpiezas que recibe de la fundación paraguaya a través de las microfranquicias de productos de limpieza, como una opción de negocio y mejoramiento.
La Sra. Veronica de este préstamo para la compra de sus productos para hacer los elementos de limpieza, que consiste en la microfranquicias de productos de limpieza. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir emprendiendo.
texts.en:
The committee is comprised of 25 women inspired by a better and good quality of life, not only for them, but also for their children. They are very hard-working and determined, and Veronica stands out among them. She is happy to be part of the committee through which she could start a new line of work. 

Veronica makes cleaning products that she gets from the Fundación Paraguaya through the cleaning products microfranchise, as an option for a business and means of improvement.

Veronica will use this loan to purchase the products to make the cleaning items, which are part of the cleaning product microfranchise. She is thankful for the opportunity that she gets to be able to continue carrying on.

loans.use: to purchase a microfranchise to make cleaning products for sale.

loans.name: Ruhana

texts.en:
Ruhana is 47 years old,and she is a mother of  three kids. Ruhana  is a very caring mother. Her first goal is to give her children a good life. For that she is working every day without rest. 

Ruhana raises seasonal fruits and vegetables such as corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. But she has a problem with water because every time she borrows water from a neighbor in order to water   her land. She  needs your financial support; for this reason; she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN .With this money she plans to buy tools and build a sluice-way. She is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest  organization for the loan.

loans.use: to buy tools and build a sluice-way

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline is 41 years old. She is married and supports two people in her family. Mercyline sells charcoal as well as groceries, a business she has done for the last seven years, earning an income of Kshs. 30,000 per month.

Mercyline is borrowing a loan of Kshs. 12,000 which she will use to purchase groceries and charcoal in bulk. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to buy a cow.

This is Mercyline's second loan after successfully repaying her previous one..She desires to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es una mujer trabajadora que forma parte del grupo de crédito El Cisne. Vive por la parroquia del Valle que se encuentra situada al suroeste de la Ciudad de Cuenca, siendo famosa por su producción de maíz, papas, etc., su atractivo turístico es la laguna de Cochapamba que se encuentran llenas de totoras (planta), la colina de Tasqui que permite una hermosa vista de la parroquia y de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy cálida y amable. 
La Señora Rosa tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, 6 de ellos son casados, un hijo trabaja pero solo para solventar sus gastos personales, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio del sector, su esposo labora en la construcción, la casa en la que viven es propia
Doña Rosa Rosa pasa en casa, pero aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la crianza de animales como pollos, cerdos y cuyes, también se dedica a la agricultura, estos trabajos son los que le ayuda a sacar adelante a su familia. El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de animales,  su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y en alimento para animales. Su grupo de crédito le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a seguir en su negocio, así como también aprende de las experiencias de sus amigas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking woman who is a member of the communal bank "El Cisne". She lives by the parish of Valle which is located Southwest from the city of Cuenca. It is famous for its production of corn, potatoes, etc. Its tourist attraction is the lagoon of Cochapamba which is filled with totoras (reeds), the hill of Tasqui where there is a beautiful view of the parish and the city of Cuenca. Its people are very warm and kind. 
Rosa is 57 years old. She is married and has 9 children with her husband; 6 of them are married. One son works, but only to support himself. His last two children are studying in the local school. Her husband works in construction. They own the house where they live. Rosa spends time at home, but in order to help with her household finances, she works raising animals, such as chickens, pigs and Guinea pigs. She also works in agriculture. These jobs are helpful to move her family forward. She invested the money from her previous loan buying animals. Her new loan will be invested buying chickens, Guinea pigs and food for the animals. She likes her communal bank because the loans help her continue in her business, and also because she learns of her girlfriends' experiences.

loans.use: To buy chickens, Guinea pigs and food for the animals.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 32 years old and single. She is a resident of Kyangwali in Western Uganda where she lives with one dependent.

Monicah is a businesswoman who deals in electronics such as radios, solar items, light bulbs, etc. She has approached UGAFODE for a loan of 3,000,000 Uganda shillings to diversify and expand her business's stock.

Monicah describes herself as honest and hardworking. She dreams  of buying land  and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase electronics for resale

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer lleva por nombre este grupo, ya que ellas quieren resurgir e ir mejorando por medio del trabajo unido del grupo, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Olinda, Directora General del Comité, quien se dedica hace tiempo a la venta de productos varios para el hogar. Gracias a esta actividad ella se encuentra mejorando cada vez más su situación económica, ya que con ello puede dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Su esposo también trabaja por lo tanto de esa forma se ayudan a mantener la casa.
La Sra. Olinda solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos para la venta, como ser jabones, aceites, leche, edulcorantes y demás para capital de trabajo, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Renacer (Rebirth) is the name of this group, since they want to revive and improve themselves through the uniting work of the group. One of the members is Orlinda, the general director of the committee, who has worked for some time selling various products for the home.  Thanks to this work, she is continuing to improve her economic situation, since with it she can provide an improved well-being for her family. Her husband also works, so in this way they help each other maintain the home.

Olinda asks for this loan to purchase products for sale, such as soaps, oil, milk, sweeteners, and other products for working capital, which will help her to increase her income and continue working.

loans.use: to purchase soaps, oil, milk, sweeteners and other products.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura en Radiología, está cursando el último año de la carrera y está realizando su pasantía en un hospital. Comenta que el préstamo que está solicitando es para la inversión en su tesis.
Comenta que sus padres son separados y su Madre se dedica a la confección de ropas, viene de una familia muy trabajadora que trabaja por salir adelante. Agradece por esta oportunidad que tiene de poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Sandra is studying for a degree in radiology. She is in her final year and completing a placement at a hospital.

Sandra says that she is applying for this loan in order to invest in paying for her thesis.

Sandra also says that her parents are separated. Her mother makes a living making clothes. Sandra comes from a very hard-working family that works to get ahead. Sandra is grateful for this opportunity to study.

loans.use: to pay the costs of her thesis.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora: Es una mujer luchadora de 55 años de edad, originaria de Waspam, casada. Desde hace 1 año estableció su pequeña pulpería, en un local que alquila en un punto estratégico, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 1000 (un mil córdobas netos). Solicita su  primer crédito para incrementar su inventario: granos básicos, huevos, chiverías, gaseosas, pan, sopas instantáneas, jabón de lavar ropa, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y su propio local.
texts.en: Aurora is a very determined woman, 55 years old, originally from Waspam, who is married. For the past year, she has established a small general store in a retail space she rents in a strategic location, paying a monthly rate of C$1000 (one thousand net córdobas). She asks for her first loan to increase her inventory of basic grains, eggs, snacks, soft drinks, bread, instant soups, and laundry detergent, among other products. Her dream is to have a prosperous business and her own retail space.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of basic grains, eggs, snacks, soft drinks, bread, instant soups, and laundry detergent, among other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, toothpaste, biscuits and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 40 years old, married, with two children, both going to school, living in Kasese, Uganda. She sells second-hand clothes and has been in that business since 1996. She sells cocoa as additional income. She began the business to be self-employed and look after her children. She dreams of expanding her business and buying a vehicle to ease her transport and add to her income. However, she is faced with a challenge of competition and high transport costs. Catherine intends to use the loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es estudiante de la carrera de Técnico en Electrónica, comenta que sus padres se dedican a la compra y venta de productos para el hogar. 
Comenta que su meta es tener un local de Electrónica, para así ayudar a sus padres más adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Jose is studying electronics and says that his parents make a living selling household products.

Jose's goal is to have an electronics shop in order to be able to help his parents in the future.

Jose is applying for this loan in order to pay university fees. This loan will cover his costs. Jose is grateful for this help.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando is a hard-working father of five children. His wife works in Spain as an Overseas Filipino Worker. With his desire to help his wife uplift their living, Orlando is the one who manages their farm. Orlando engages in farming, growing rice in their field. He has a wide area of farm to support, and that’s why he is asking for a loan of P50,000. He will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and fuel. Orlando will manage his farm well to increase his yields and able to save some of his earnings for the next crop season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and fuel.

loans.name: Estela Amalia

texts.es: Estela: Es una mujer trabajadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada, tiene 10 hijos: 6 mayores de edad y 4 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Su esposo es técnico en refrigeración. Desde hace 2 años ha trabajado en la modalidad de grupos solidarios, con el objetivo de incrementar su inventario de venta de bastimentos y carne de cerdo. Solicita su primer financiamiento en la modalidad de crédito individual para comprar: Coco, limón, plátanos, nancite, yuca, pilipitas y engordar cerdos, posteriormente vender la carne a precios accesibles. Su sueño es tener un camión para transportar sus productos de su finca al municipio de Puerto cabezas.
texts.en:
Estela is a hard-working woman. She is 53 years old and originally from Puerto Cabezas. Estela is married and has ten children: six are now adults while the last four are teenagers who are attending high school. Estela's husband is a fridge technician. For two years Estela has been a member of the loan groups. Her aim is to increase stock and pig meat.

Estela is applying for her first individual loan in order to buy coconut, lemon, plantains and yuccas, and to fatten up pigs, which she will later sell at affordable prices. Estela's dream is to own a truck for transporting her goods from her farm to the Puerto Cabezas municipality.

loans.use: to buy coconut, lemon, plantains and yuccas, and to fatten up pigs.

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es:
El sol se llama este grupo, está en su ciclo 1 del programa de comités, ellas están emocionadas por poder capacitarse y salir adelante. Una mujer que se destaca es Zunilda, quien tiene una peluquería donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se está dedicando por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de su esfuerzo. Hoy ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para surtir su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, tintes y demás, de manera a seguir dando a sus clientes el buen servicio al que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
El Sol (The Sun) is the name of this group, in its first loan cycle in the committee program; they are excited to be able to train themselves and get ahead. One woman who stands out among them is Zunilda, who has a beauty salon where she works every day from the very early hours of the day.

She is a very hard-working and determined woman, who is working hard to get ahead and help her family through her efforts. Today, she asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of various supplies to stock her beauty salon, such as shampoo, rinses, creams, dyes, and other products and in this way continue giving her customers the good service to which they are accustomed.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, rinses, creams, dyes, and other products

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer muy trabajadora, que pese a las adversidades y las dificultades del día a día esta saliendo adelante y lucha por poder crecer en su emprendimiento que es la despensa que tiene. Comenta que gracias a si préstamo anterior pudo comprar insumos para surtir su despensa, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar nuevamente insumos para su despensa, como ser huevo, golosinas, tortas, jabón en polvo, suavizantes, etc.
texts.en:
Virginia is a very hard-working woman and, in spite of every day adversities and difficulties, she is getting ahead and fighting to expand her grocery store. Virginia says that, thanks to her previous loan, she was able to buy supplies to stock up her shop. This was a great help to her.

Today Virginia is applying for a new loan in order to buy new more supplies for her grocery store including eggs, sweets, cakes, powdered soap, and fabric softener.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sweets, cakes, powdered soap, fabric softener and more.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo actualmente se encuentra en el 4to. año de la carrera de Ingeniería en Informática, también está trabajando con su papa en una empresa familiar.
Tiene varias expectativas, ya que le gustaría trabajar en una Empresa en donde él pueda desarrollar lo que estudia, y de esa forma seguir luchando por sus metas.
El pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma estar cada vez más cerca de cumplir su meta. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Gerardo is currently in fourth year studying computing. He also works for his father at the family business. Gerardo has various plans: he would like to work in a business where he can practise his profession and continue fighting to achieve his aims.

Gerardo is applying for this loan in order to pay university fees and to come closer to achieving his goal. Gerardo is grateful for this opportunity, which will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly proviene de una familia muy trabajadora, y comenta que se cómo una profesional, responsable, y con mucho futuro.
Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, con lo que quiere ayudar a las personas que necesiten de ella y de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Nelly comes from a very hard-working family and says that she is a responsible professional with a big future.

Nelly is studying accounting. She wants to use this degree to help others with her knowledge.

Nelly is applying for this loan to invest in paying university fees and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene vive en la ciudad de Encarnación, con sus padres, actualmente trabaja y a la vez está estudiando.
Actualmente está cursando la carrera de derecho está en él 6to año, el principal objetivo de Marlene es terminar su carrera y trabajar en forma independiente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma seguir para poder cumplir con su meta y agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Marlene lives in the city of Encarnación with her parents. She currently works and studies.

Marlene is studying law. She is in sixth year. Marlene's main goal is to finish her degree and work independently.

Marlene is applying for this loan in order to pay university fees. That way she can continue to work to achieve her aim. Marlene is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene como meta propia recibirse como licenciado en la carrera que está siguiendo que es la de profesor de educación física para poder enseñar en las mejores instituciones públicas y privadas y así generar más ingreso para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que así podrá cubrir el gasto que esto representa, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en: Juan has a goal to receive a license for the career he his following which is physical education teacher so he can teach in the best public and private institutions and thus earn more income to improve his quality of life and that of his family. He is requesting this loan to be able to invest in his education costs since then he will be able to pay the expense that this represents and in this way be able to keep working towards his goal.

loans.use: to pay education expenses.

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Judas Tadeo está en su ciclo número 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y por medio del trabajo en conjunto están luchando por mejorar sus vidas.
Liz, una de las integrantes de este grupo está luchando por salir adelante por medio de su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de este grupo. Liz se encarga de la venta de comidas varias que ella misma hace, y también en la venta de ensaladas de frutas.
Liz está pidiendo este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, condimentos, hortalizas, frutas y demás insumos para preparar sus comidas, y también ensalada de frutas. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
The group called San Juda Tadeo is in its 12th loan cycle in the women's committee program, where everyone works and through the work together, they are fighting to improve their lives.

Liz, one of the members of this group, is fighting to get ahead through her efforts and the help of this group. Liz works selling various foods that she makes herself, and also selling fruit salads. 

Lis is asking for this loan to be ale to purchase vegetables, seasonings, fruit, and other supplies to prepare her food, and also fruit salad. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting.

loans.use:
to purchase vegetables, seasonings, 
 fruit and other supplies

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es una arquitecta, tiene 43 años, ella proviene de una Familia de comerciantes, su papa se dedica al comercio en la ciudad de Asunción.
Estudió Arquitectura y se recibió en el año 1999 y con la ayuda de su familia se independizo hace 15 años teniendo su propio negocio, y a la par de eso es asesora, comenta que le está yendo muy bien en su profesión y que ha ganado mucha clientela.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la financiación de planos y de tasaciones. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Patricia is an architect; she is 43 years old and comes from a family of business people. Her father works as a merchant in the city of Asunción. 

She studied architecture and got her degree in 1999, and with the help of her family she became independent 15 years ago with her own business and also she is an assessor. She says that she is doing very well in her profession and she has gotten a large client base.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in financing plans and assessments. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is getting and which will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to pay for plans and appraisals.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector está en etapa de su tesis, comenta que le resulta difícil un poco difícil, pero que poco a poco con su esfuerzo y el apoyo de su familia lo está pudiendo lograr.
Su objetivo es ser un analista de sistemas es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas. Está contento por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Hector is at the stage of his thesis. He notes that it has been a little difficult but, gradually, with hard work and the support of his family he has been able to achieve. His objective is to be a systems analyst and for this he is studying systems analysis. He is happy for the opportunity that he is receiving which will be a lot of help. He is requesting this loan to be able to cover his education expenses which will be helpful.

loans.use: to pay education expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pay for the labor cost in planting.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en: Aside from her retailing business, Adoracion also spends her time in managing their farm. She grows corn in their farm. Adoracion is married to a farmer and blessed with four children. She is proud to share that through farming two of her children finished college. Adoracion dreams of seeing her youngest child finish his studies. She will do her best to attain her dream. With regard to her farming business, Adoracion is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pay for the labor cost in farming. She is hoping to have good weather conditions to have good crops as well.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pay for the labor cost in farming.

loans.name: Laheri

texts.en:
Laheri is a 28-year-old married woman with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Laheri makes craft baskets, a business she has operated for 14 years alongside making bricks for additional income. She began the business to meet daily family demands. 

She is a hardworking woman, but she is faced with a challenge of  limited capital. She dreams of expanding her business and finishing her house. 
Laheri intends to use the loan to buy weaving materials like threads.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo La victoria está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la capital y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente.
La Sra.  Maria es una de las integrantes, ella se desempeña como almacenera y por las tardes tiene un carrito de panchero en el que vende por las noches comestibles, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, y por sobre todo luchadora y sacrificada.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, artículos varios de limpieza, y demás para poder surtir su despensa, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The La Victoria group is in its 6th loan cycle in the program of women's committees.  It is from the city of Concepción, which is in an area a bit far from the capital and is still developing.  It is an area difficult to access, so the members of this group want to fight to develop and give the area where they live a better atmosphere. 

Maria is one of the members. She works as a storekeeper and in the afternoons she has a food cart where she sell food in the evenings.  She is a very hard-working woman and, above all, determined and self-sacrificing.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetables, fruits, cleaning products, and others to be able to stock her shop and in this way be able to continue working as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruit, various cleaning products, and other supplies for sale.

loans.name: Germima

texts.en:
Germima is a 32-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She is in a food vending business (fresh foods) that she began to have a source of income to support her family's needs. 

Germima hopes to expand her business, but she is faced with a problem of limited capital. She intends to use the loan to buy bananas and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cement machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of gari for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres Activas inicia el 3º Ciclo del programa Comité Mujeres Emprendedoras. Existen un total de 17 mujeres que cuentan diversas actividades, pero donde todas se están ayudando para poder salir adelante e ir mejorando.
Elizabeth es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas varias, y comenta que por medio de sus ventas está ayudando a su familia, dándoles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una mujer muy sacrificada que empieza su día a día desde muy tempranas horas. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar vinos, gaseosas, cervezas y demás bebidas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por salir adelante por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Activas group begins its 3rd loan cycle in the Enterprising Women's Committees program. There are a total of 17 woman who have a variety of lines of work, but where all are helping each other to be able to get ahead and improve themselves.

Elizabeth is one of the members of this group. She works selling various drinks and says that through her sales, she is helping her family, giving them everything that she couldn't have. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who begins her day from the very early hours. She asks for this loan to be able to purchase wines, soft drinks, beer, and other drinks, since in this way she will be able to continue with her sales, fighting to get ahead through her work.

loans.use: to purchase wines, soft drinks, beer and other drinks for sale.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
“Strike anywhere” was Sandra’s favorite guiding principle in reaching her dreams. 

Sandra is engaged in vending of snack foods and cold juice in front of a school. Sometimes she sells burgers when there are big events in different schools. Sandra enjoys what she is doing and that’s why she has reached 11 years operating the business. 

Sandra wishes a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy a burger machine, drinks, powdered juice, and many more items. Sandra and her husband work together to give the best life to their child. She will manage the business well for continued growth of it in order to increase their income and able to finish their house improvement project through their income.

loans.use: to buy a burger machine, drinks, powdered juice, and many more items.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 41 year old widow who supports a family of six children and has been running a vegetable and fruit business for four years, earning an income of KES. 2,000.

Lilian is now on her third loan of KES. 19,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to build a business stall and add more stock. 

Lilian plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and hopes to have a bright future for her children.

loans.use: To build a business stall and to add additional vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw meats and ingredients that she needs in cooking dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a lot of cattle to expand her capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil and maggi cubes to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil and maggi cubes to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of gari for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Nancy Aurora

texts.es: Nancy: Es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 29 años de edad, casada con 1 hijo de 5 años de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace más de 4 años estableció en conjunto con su esposo un negocio de venta de repuestos de motocicletas. Solicita financiamiento para comprar productos: sporket, cadenas, tablero, manecilla, cables, entre otros productos. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y ser mayorista.
texts.en: Nancy is a hard-working woman, 29 years old, married with one 5-year-old child.  With the goal of having her own source of income, over 4 years ago, she  established a business with her husband selling motorcycle parts.  She asks for this loan to purchase products: sprockets, chains, panels, needles, and cables, among other products. Her dream is to expand her business and to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase products such as sprockets, chains, panels, needles, and cables, among other products

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is 31 years old, widowed and supports two children, ages 11 and 10 years old.  She has been in tailoring services for the last five years and earns an income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	
Risper is now on her third loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy more fabric and sewing materials for dresses and  to sell to her customers.

The profit she earns will be used to pay school fees for her children. She hopes for growth in her business

loans.use: to add more fabric and sewing materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth, es soltera,  tiene un  hijo dependiente a su cargo, vive con su pareja, es de familia humilde, sencilla y trabajadora, su principal actividad es la venta de comida, con una antigüedad de un año, ofrece una variedad de comidas a elección y los ambientes de dicho restaurant están en su mismo domicilio. Actualmente solicita un crédito para capital de operación para comprar sillas, mesas y enseres de cocina para la preparación de sus platos, que le servirá para incrementar sus ventas y dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes, por consiguiente podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Elizabeth is single. She has a son in her care. She lives with her partner and is from a humble, simple and hard working family. Her main activity is selling food. In business for one year, she offers a variety of food to choose from and the location of the restaurant is in her house. Currently, she is requesting a loan for operating capital to buy chairs, tables and kitchen utensils to prepare her dishes which will help her increase sales and give greater comfort to her customers. This will then improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and kitchen appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a piece of land for his son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of gari for resale.

loans.name: Cylviah

texts.en:
Cylviah is a married woman with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She makes craft baskets, a business she started to meet her family's daily demands. She is a hardworking woman but she is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations coupled with high license fees. She dreams of expanding her business into a renowned craft center. 

She intends to use the loan to buy craft materials to use.

loans.use: to buy craft materials.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane is self-employed and comes from Jrapi village of Shirak region. She lives with her husband, mother, brother, and daughter. Jointly with her family members, Gayane has been engaged in agriculture for many years. In particular, they breed cattle, hens, and pigs and cultivate corn, potatoes, and various types of fruit. With a very good credit history, Gayane has now applied for a loan of USD 2000. With the requested amount she wants to expand her agricultural business. In particular, she  is going to pay for 40 bags of fertilizers, animal feed (1000 kg), pesticides, and purchase two pigs. This hard-working family has no other revenue sources. This is why they really need to sustain their agricultural business. They will be grateful to all the lenders for their goodwill in helping them collect the needed loan.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers (40 bags), animal feed (1000 kg), pesticides, and livestock (2 pigs)

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Maria trabaja como independiente en una salsamentaría en el municipio de marinilla. Trabaja todos los días y los fines de semana contrata a dos personas más para que le ayuden en su negocio.
Por ser un establecimiento en el que se vende licor y otras bebidas, es muy concurrido y con muy buenas ventas.
Ella desea ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos, surtiendo su negocio con gaseosas, otros licores, frituras, entre otros, y es por esta razón que acude muy gentilmente a un crédito ya que este le permitirá continuar mejorando en su negocio y darle una renovación.
Es una mujer muy emprendedora y soñadora, desea tener una casa propia para ofrecerles a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Maria works independently in a small grocery store in the town of Marinilla.  She works every day of the week and on the weekends.  She is hiring two more people to help with the business.  Since it is an establishment that sells liquor and other drinks, it is very busy and has good sales.  

Maria wishes to offer her customers a better variety of products by stocking up her business with sodas, other liquors, fried foods, and other items.  This is the reason that she very kindly asks for a loan.  It will allow her to continue improving her business and to renovate it.  She is a very hard-working woman and a dreamer; she wishes to have her own house so that she can give it to her children.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel wants to help her husband even in a simple way. While her husband operates their tricycle for passengers’ transportation, Maribel manages their farm. They grow two hectares of corn. Both of their sources of income serve as their sustenance for their family's basic needs.
