Her husband's earnings on their tricycle are enough only to sustain their daily needs. Maribel wants to borrow a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers for their farm. Maribel will use the loan wisely to provide their needed farm inputs, and this will lessen their worries in not providing their farm needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for their farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar en el año 2004 se graduó como Profesor de matemáticas, proviene de una familia de docentes.
Su meta es lograr tener una empresa propia e ir fortaleciendo de esa manera su situación económica, se ve de aquí a unos años como administrador de una empresa importante y reconocida. Hoy está estudiando otra carrera que es la de administración de empresas, y pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir este gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Oscar, in the year 2004, graduated as a mathematics teacher.  He comes from a family of teachers.  His goal is to manage to have his own company and to be strengthening his financial situation in this way.  From here in a few years he sees himself as an administrator of an important and recognized company.  Today he is studying for another degree in business administration and he is requesting this loan to be able to cover the costs of the degree.  In this way he will be able to cover this cost.

loans.use: to pay the costs of his thesis.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a self-employed woman from Tegh village of Syunik region. She lives with her her husband and three sons. 

Jointly with her husband, Gohar has been engaged in animal husbandry for many years. They keep cows, hens, pigs, and even a turkey. Unfortunately, their sons are still teenagers and are not able to help them. Gohar's husband sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

Now Gohar wants to buy 25 sheep to expand her family's agribusiness and make it more profitable. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of USD 3,000. It is really hard for Gohar and her husband as they need more money than ever to grow their sons. There is nobody else who can help them. 

Let's support this hardworking woman and her family to overcome difficulties in their lives and become financially more stable. They will appreciate the help of all the lenders.

loans.use: to buy 25 sheep.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es una de persona que se está esforzando por salir adelante, es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está estudiando la carrera de Odontología, comenta que cuando termine la carrera quiere hacer un doctorado e ir a estudiar al extranjero.
Nora pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de la universidad, como fotocopias, materiales y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Está agradecido por la ayuda que está recibiendo de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Nora is one of those people trying very hard to get ahead.  She is from the city of Caaguazú and she is studying for a career in dentistry.  She says that when she finishes her studies she wants to work on a doctorate and go to study abroad.  Nora is requesting this loan in order to be able to cover her university costs such as photocopies, materials and other things.  In this way she will be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.  

She is grateful for the help that she is receiving to be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to cover university costs like photocopies, materials and other things.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de San Pedro, está estudiando dos carreras, la de derecho y psicología clínica.
Comenta que su meta al terminar sus carreras es trabajar en lo que refiere a ellas, y de esa forma ayudar a las personas que necesitan de sus conocimientos.
Maria pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula de la universidad, y también cubrir otros gastos de estudios. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of San Pedro.  She is studying in two fields: law and clinical psychology.  She says that her goal upon finishing her studies is to work in something related to them and in this way help people who are in need of her expertise.  Maria is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay her university registration fees and also to cover other costs of her studies.  

She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university registration fees and to cover the costs of her studies.

loans.name: Moris

texts.en:
Moris, age 30 years, is a married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He sells palm oil, a business he ventured into for a source of income to help him meet his family's needs. He is faced with a challenge of limited capital that hinders his business growth. 

Moris needs the loan to buy palm oil to sell, which will help him increase his capital.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 42 years old. He is married to Leah and together they support seven members in their family. Leah sells groceries. Their children are between 5 and 13 years old.

Wilson is a carpenter, a business he has done for the last 10 years earning a monthly income of KHS 15,000. This KHS 10,000 loan is his first with VisionFund Kenya.

Wilson hopes and dreams of supporting his family and growing his business.

loans.use: to buy materials for carpentry

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es de la carrera de obstetricia, es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder salir adelante y cumplir su meta de ser una profesional exitosa que ayuda a las demás personas. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en comprar materiales didácticos para su universidad.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de manutención y transporte, con lo cual podrá cubrir ese gasto y seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Laura is studying obstetrics.  She is a person who is struggling to be able to get ahead and to fulfill her goal of being a successful professional that helps other people.  She says that she used the previous loan to purchase education materials for her university.  Today she is requesting a new loan in order to be able to cover her living expenses and transportation costs.  With this she will be able to cover this cost and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for living expenses and transportation.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Janet, a 38-year-old smallholder farmer from Kenya. She is a wife and a mother of two lovely school-going children. Janet, born 3rd in a family of 8, has described her upbringing as challenging. For this reason, she is doing everything in her power to provide her children with a better foundation. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like Janet to turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan / asset financing.

Janet owns 0.8 acres of land in Kaptumo, near the town called Nandi Hills. On the farm, she keeps five dairy cows and 132 chickens. She also grows tomatoes for both family consumption and to sell in the market. Many trees are planted around her home along with flowers and various works of art. It is obvious that Janet is very passionate about the health of the environment and the beauty of her surroundings.

Janet has been farming for the last five years. She has made great strides and started an agro-shop that gives farmers in the village access to necessary farm supplies.  She has employed three people to help run her small business.  

She is very active member of a small group of fellow smallholder farmers who empower each other to become better entrepreneurs. She is also up to speed with the latest technology: She accesses the internet regularly and she uses MPESA services to transfer money through mobile phones.

However, Janet still faces a number of challenges. Many women in Kenya are responsible not only for producing food but also feeding their families. For women like Janet, having access to financial resources through Juhudi and Kiva will increase their productivity and improve their future.

Janet is seeking a loan to construct a dairy unit, to purchase more stock for her agro-shop, and to grow tomatoes. The financial benefits she will reap from the loan are almost immediate. Janet has successfully cleared Juhudi Kilimo loans in the past on time. From her loan appraisal, Janet is disciplined with money - She updates her budget on a monthly basis, tracks every income and expense and approaches new business opportunities with caution.

loans.use: To construct a cowshed, purchase inventory for her agro-shop and grow tomatoes

loans.name: Truphena

texts.en:
Truphena is 35 years old, widowed, and supports three children ages 18 and 15 years and 10 years.  She has been selling green vegetables for the last 15 years and earns an income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	
Truphena is now servicing her second loan of 15,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy more stock of assorted vegetables  to sell to her customers.

The profit she earns will be used to pay school fees for her children. She hopes for growth in her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables for sale

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is 43 years old and blessed with two children. She runs a school, and this has been her passion as well as income-generating service for seven years. Her children are 20 years old and 6 years old. Her monthly income currently is 50,000 Kenya shillings.

Caren has requested a loan of Kshs. 30,000 in order to purchase furniture and stationery for her school. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya.
With the profits earned, she will be able to enlarge her business to become one of the best in the country.

loans.use: to purchase stationery and furniture

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a self-employed woman from Barepat village. She lives with her husband and mother. Gohar's son serves in the armed forces of Armenia. Together with her family members, she has been engaged in agriculture for many years. They breed cattle and hens, cultivate corn and potatoes, and grow fruit. Gohar's mother is an 82-year-old pensioner and it is really hard for her to get fully engaged in agricultural activities. Gohar's husband sells the agricultural produce in the local market.

 In order to improve living conditions for their livestock, they want to buy a new plot of agricultural land and build a new barn there. For this purpose Gohar has applied for a loan of USD 3000. This family really needs help to sustain their agricultural business and grow it further. They will appreciate any support from the lenders.

loans.use: to buy new agricultural land and build a barn on it

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: La señora Edith de 26 años de edad , vive en el municipio de Monteagudo, en  un cuarto en alquiler, su actividad principal es la venta de refresco y su conyugue trabaja como albañil en una empresa constructora, ambos generan sus ingresos para su diario vivir, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina mescladora y herramientas de trabajo para su esposo con el fin de poder trabajar independientemente y agarrar sus propios contratos ya que lo que ganan cada mes no es suficiente para poder mantener a su familia, por lo tanto la señora y su conyugue  podrán incrementar sus ingresos para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Edith is 26 years old, lives in the town of Monteagudo in a rented room, and makes a living selling soft drinks.  Her spouse works as a bricklayer in a construction business.  They both generate income for their daily lives.  She has two children who rely on her.

At this time Edith is asking for a loan in order to buy a mixer and work tools for her husband so that he can work independently and get his own contracts since what they earn each month is not enough to maintain their family.  This way Edith and her husband will be able to increase their income in order to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a mixer and other work tools.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for twelve years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are travelers. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a deep freezer for her restaurant and add stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells. Her business goal is to hire more staff within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be contented. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: buy a deep freezer for her restaurant and add stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for twenty years. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be happy. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Davidson

texts.en:
Davidson is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be polite. He operates a business where he makes bricks. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are contractors. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transportation costs.

Davidson will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bricks. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be happy. This is his second loan with SMEP Micro-finance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bricks

loans.name: Marika

texts.en:
Marika is a 38-year-old woman from Senaki district. She has a school-aged son and daughter, whom she takes care of alone. Marika's husband died and the family lost their only breadwinner. Marika had to start any activity to generate some subsistence income for her children, so she started to work as a cleaner, but her income is insignificant and family still lives in poverty. The children do get an orphan's pension from the  local government. 

Marika  dreams to make better living conditions for her family and do her significant bit for the family's welfare. She requested a loan for starting a trading business and somehow increasing her generated income. 

Marika will use this loan for purchasing a stock of children's clothing and various home products in the capital at wholesale prices and will sell the goods at a higher price locally. She will get private orders also, that will be compatible with her customers' needs. 

Marika hopes that Kiva lenders can provide her business with needed money to reach her main goal, to give good education for her children and live in better conditions. Marika is relying on the goodwill of lenders and awaits your support.

loans.use: To start up a business selling clothing

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy vive en casa de sus padres, trabaja como grafico en una imprenta, su casa está ubicada en La Paz.

Eloy, percibe solo un sueldo donde trabaja  más de ocho horas, el crédito que solicita es para  independeizarse, Eloy esta muy animado y quiere abrir su propia imprenta por lo que pide un prestamo para comprar un par de maquinas de impresion Eloy es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda.
texts.en:
Eloy lives with his parents. He works as a graphic designer for a printing company. His house is located in La Paz.

Eloy receives only a wage from his job where he works more than eight hours a day. The loan he is requesting is to become independent. He is very inspired and wants to open his own printing house and for that he is applying for a loan in order to purchase a couple of printing presses. Eloy is the only source of income in his household. Consequently he needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase two printing presses.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa es viuda y tiene un hijo, ella vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su padre. Debido a las lluvias las paredes del hogar sufrieron rajaduras y necesitan reparacion Felipa trabaja como supervisora municipal Felipa es la unica que contribuye en la economia familiar, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Felipa is a widow and she has a child. She lives with her parents in La Paz in a house made of brick and cement that belongs to her father. Because of the rain, the walls of the home cracked, and they need repairs. 

Felipa works as a municipal supervisor. Felipa is the only one who contributes to the family income; for this reason she needs your help.

loans.use: to repair the walls of the house where she lives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of ground nuts to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a suitable area and her primary customers are local residents. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to have a large warehouse within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. Judith operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her primary customers are frequent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. Judith will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to improve within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Dominick

texts.en: Dominick is a male Kiva borrower. He operates a tailoring business where he sells textile products. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in an area conducive for business and his primary customers are women's groups. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of materials. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy a tailoring machine. His business goal is to own lots of machines within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 20 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. Fredrick operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area with potential for business growth and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as not enough space to store the maize. 

Fredrick will use the 98,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals. This will enable him to have more stock to sell, hence more sales and profits. His business goal is to have more customers within 5 years due to large stock. Fredrick hopes that in the future, he will educate his children and construct a store where he can store cereals. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits for a store to store cereals.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia, who is a 30-year-old married woman, lives in Gurjaani district. She has a husband, son, and grandmother, who gets monthly assistance from local government. 

Natia and her husband both are employed in private companies and generate fixed salaries. In order to make her activity more productive Natia decided to start her own business and requested a loan. Her application was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start-up program that gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. 

So she decided to open a bakery with the requested money. Natia will purchase all merchandise and food products and will start to bake many kinds of cakes and will sell locally at a good price. Natia will have her own customers, will sell cakes from her house, and also will deliver her products to the local stores. 

This new business will give her a chance to achieve financial stability, more easily meet daily expenses, and make a better future for her son. Natia will accumulate savings and will be grateful for your help.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and food products and open a bakery

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, milk, rice and other items. Her business is located in a good market and her primary customers are both men and women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, milk and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have an improved life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, sugar, milk and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand and cement to be used in making more hollow blocks to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself as ambitious. 

Gladys operates a retail business where she sells tailoring materials. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in  a developing area and her primary customers are daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a business that will supply materials to many people within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, her business will be stable and she will sustain her family. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre está en busca de distintas alternativas para la obtención de ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus tres hijos.
Desde que su esposo el abandono ella se vio obligada a trabajar y a salir adelante con sus hijos.
Actualmente se dedica la producción de arepas caseras que prepara en su propia casa desde hace 4 años; también tiene gallinas ponedoras y vende productos a través de catálogos.
Tiene gran experiencia en estos campos y es muy dedicada a su trabajo.
Ella tiene la esperanza de tener un apoyo económico para la construcción de un horno más grande a base de leña que le permita mejoras su cocción, desea comprar también mas ollas y utensilios de cocina; adicionalmente desea comprar más gallinas ponedoras para aumentar su capital.
Es una mujer valiente y nunca se ha detenido por más fuertes que sean los problemas.
texts.en:
Sra. Beatriz is a very hardworking person and is always looking for different ways to earn money to support her three children. Since her husband abandoned her she has had to  work in order to get ahead with her children.

Currently she makes homemade tortillas. She has been making them in her home for four years. She also has laying hens and sells products from catalogs. She has had a lot of experience in these areas and is very dedicated to her work.

She hopes to get the financial support to build a larger wood burning oven that will enable her to improve her cooking. She also wants to buy more pots and kitchen utensils. In addition she wants to purchase more laying hens in order to increase her capital.

She is a courageous woman and has never stopped no matter how difficult her problems.

loans.use: to build a larger over and to purchase pots and laying hens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to have a stable business with branches in other towns within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business that will sustain her family. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent used the previous loan to pay school fees. He deals in the business of clothes and his clients are women and men. He gets additional income from salary and farming. He started his business to increase his income. He wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. He has hopes of educating his children. He is a hardworking man and his major challenge is the ever changing fashion and designs on the market.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en: Zeddy is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as confident. She operates a farm where she sells tea leaves. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a favorable area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be small sales returns. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy tea leaves for resale. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: La señora Nicolasa es una persona humilde, responsable y trabajadora vive en provincia de Quillacollo actualmente se dedica a la producción de leche, actividad que desde hace años fue dejada por sus padres y al comercio de ganado porcino; tiene cincuenta y cuatro años de edad, se dedica a la lechería desde hace más de dieciocho años y también a la agricultura donde siembra alfalfa para el consumo de su ganado bovino lechero, la señora es una persona respetada y ejemplar para sus hijos , a los cuales está sacando adelante. Ahora necesita un crédito para la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado bovino lechero, ya que quiere acumular este insumo para la actividad de la lechería y así abastecerse del mismo para cuando suba de precio en temporada de invierno, de esta forma mantendrá su nivel de ingresos y podrá poco a poco mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nicolasa is a humble person, responsible and hard-working, who lives in the province of Quillacollo. Currently she works in dairy production, a line of work that many years ago her parents left her, and also in trading pigs. She is forty-four years old, and has worked in dairy for more than eighteen years and also in agriculture where she grows alfalfa for the consumption of her dairy cows. She is a respected person and a model for her children, who she is getting ahead.  Now she needs a loan to purchase balanced feed for her dairy cows, since she wants to accumulate this supply for the dairy business and stock up on it for when the prices rise in the winter, in this way she will maintain her level of income and will, little by little, be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for dairy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos de maíz y de chuño, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solictan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de maíz.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS” y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The member continues with her business selling products made from corn and chuño [a freeze-dried potato product].  She has had this business for a good while, and it is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her business every day.  She sells her merchandise to the customers who ask for it; she wants to be able to continue working and in this way to continue supporting her family.

The member asks for the loan to purchase corn.  

She belongs to the communal bank "LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS" and is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory of clothes

loans.name: Julliet

texts.en: Julliet is a married woman. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. Her business is located in a populated area, and her primary customers shop frequently. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more charcoal. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have frequent cash flow and a good lifestyle. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and add to her savings.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. Her business goal is to own a salon within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis tiene el proyecto de montar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa ubicada en el municipio de La Dorada aprovechando que en el sector donde vive no hay de este tipo de negocios y se siente la necesidad de una.
Su plan es que la tienda poco a poco pueda convertirse en un minimercado.
Posee gran experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocios gracias a sus trabajos en distintas tiendas.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos de la canasta familiar.
Con estos elementos podrá realizar su sueño y tendrá ingresos estables para la manutención de su familia.
Es una persona muy organizada y manifiesta mucho entusiasmo con esta idea.
texts.en:
Luis has a plan to open a grocery store in his house located in the municipality of La Dorada, taking advantage of the area where he lives where there isn't any of this type of business and he feels the need to have one.

His plan is that the store will little by little become a mini-market.

He has a lot of experience in running this type of business thanks to his work in various stores.

He asks for this loan to purchase shelves, display cases and an assortment of products for the family pantry.

With these things, he will be able to realize his dream and will have stable income for his family's sustenance.

He is a very organized person and shows a lot of enthusiasm for this idea.

loans.use: to purchase shelves, display cases and an assortment of products.

loans.name: Ana Yanethe

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 25 años de edad, es casada, madre de 1 niño de dos años de edad su esposo se encuentra trabajando en el extranjero, su nivel de educación es de noveno grado, su sueño se le trunco porque cuando estudiaba salió embarazada, por esa razón tuvo que casarse con el padre de su bebe, ella vive junto a los suegros y él bebe, pero no dependen de ella la única persona que depende de ella es su hijo.  
		 
Ana se dedica a cuidar a un bebe, sus padres salen a trabajar y por eso la han contratado de niñera porque requiere ayuda y cuido, ella tiene ya 2 años de cuidar al bebe, gracias a ello ha obtenido, gran experiencia y conocimiento en la actividad. 

Ana también está estudiando cosmetología, comenta que este estudio le permitirá generarle mayores ingresos económicos  a su familia,  porque es una actividad que le gusta mucho y es su pasión. El trabajo de cuidar al bebe lo realiza por la mañana entra a las 6 de la mañana y sale al medio día  y por la tarde va a  recibir las clases de 3 de la tarde y sale a las 6 pm, ella tiene que tomar 2 buses para llegar a su lugar de trabajo y al estudio.

El financiamiento del crédito lo utilizara para invertirlo para la cancelación de otra deuda que tiene y para hacer la compra de algunas máquinas y productos de cosmetología, gracias al préstamo ella comprara algunas herramientas que necesita para  echar en marcha su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos para su familia pero primero desea terminar sus estudios de cosmetología.

En primer lugar desea poder montar su propio salón de belleza en su casa, pues siempre ha sido su principal sueño de su negocio y de poder emplear personas y en un futuro también tener su propia escuela de belleza, ella también desea seguir estudiando una carreara universitaria, también apoyar económicamente a su hijo para que estudie mucho y sea una persona de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Ana is a 25-year-old young woman, married, and mother of 1 child who is two years old.  Her husband is working abroad; she finished the ninth grade, her dream was cut short because while she was studying, she got pregnant. For this reason, she had to marry the father of the baby. She lives with her parents-in-law and the baby, but they don't depend on her. The only person who depends on her is her child.

Ana works taking care of a baby. The parents leave to work and for this they hired her as a nanny because the baby requires help and care. She has cared for this baby for 2 years. Thanks to this, she has gained significant experience and knowledge of the job.

Ana also is studying cosmetology. She says that this study will allow her to generate more income for her family, because it is a line of work that she likes a lot and which is her passion. She does the job of caring for the baby from 6:00 in the morning and leaves at midday and during the afternoon, she takes classes from 3:00 in the afternoon and leaves at 6:00pm. She has to take 2 busses to arrive at her workplace and school. 

The loan will be used to invest in paying off another debt that she has and to purchase some cosmetology machines and products. Thanks to the loan, she will purchase some tools that she needs to start her business and get more income for her family.  But first, she wants to finish her cosmetology program.

In the first place, she wants to set up her own beauty salon in her house, since it has always been her primary dream to have a business and be able to employ people and in the future to also have her own beauty school. She also wants to continue studying for a university degree, also to economically support her sun so that he can study a lot and be a good person in society.

loans.use: to pay off another debt that she has and to purchase some cosmetology machines and products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an air conditioner.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en:
Hugo is one of Kubo Financiero’s clients and this is his story:

Hugo is 39 years old, married and a father of two girls, 17 and 5 years old. He makes a living as a driver of a public transportation unit in the State of Mexico, which has been his for ten years now; additionally he sells clothes brought from the United States.

He works his unit from Monday to Friday from 5 AM to 10 PM covering his route, and on weekends and every other day he sells clothes in a nearby tianguis (open air market). Recently his van has presented mechanical issues which need to be repaired, and that is why he asks for this loan.

With the effort he puts into his job, Hugo aspires to continue providing for his family and be able to offer his daughters a good standard of living.

loans.use: to repair some mechanical issues with his public transport unit

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a small entrepreneur and Kubo Financiero’s client, and this is her story:

Yolanda is 49 years old, married, and has a daughter. She makes a living by tending a food stand which is located on a street corner near her house and she is known in the neighborhood because of it. She describes herself as a calm person.

Her stand is made out of sheet metal and is about two meters in length, plus the space occupied by chairs and tables for her customers; there she sells suadero, longaniza, al pastor and alambre tacos. She is asking for this loan to repair the awning of her stand, which is damaged and has been torn by the heavy rainy season in Mexico City.

Thanks to the effort she puts into her work, Yolanda has been able to raise her daughter and open her stand. She aspires to continue growing it and open up a new one in the future.

loans.use: to replace the awning of her stand

loans.name: Erina

texts.en:
Erina is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 25 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a fridge for business use. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent house. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a fridge for business use

loans.name: María Olivia

texts.es:
María de 51 años de edad,  no sabe leer ni escribir,  debido a que su madre decidió no ponerla a  la escuela para que le ayudara en su casa con los oficios del hogar, ella está acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura siembra de granos básicos, tienen 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores y están casados, en su casa solamente habitan dos personas su esposo y ella.

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ella siempre desde que era pequeña se dedicó a esta actividad debido a que su madre le enseño a realizarla y entonces ella no opto por aprender otra actividad, y debido a que ella se caso tenía que cuidar del esposo e hijos, ella no tiene horario para realizar esta actividad debido a que durante el día tiene muchos quehaceres y no tiene horario definido.


El préstamo lo utilizara para la agricultura la compra del paquete agrícola, abono, insecticidas, y la preparación de la tierra, ella comenta que gracias al otorgamiento del crédito, podrá tener mejores cosechas y poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para mejorar su calidad y la de su esposo. 

María para un futuro desea tener un mejor terreno para sus siembras y poder hacer mejores y más  sus grandes cosechas, también comenta que desea poder tener  una granja de pollo de engorde que le genere mayores ingresos para su esposo y ella, todo esto dice que lo lograra ahorrando mucho he invirtiendo para que sus sueños junto a su esposo se hagan realidad.
texts.en:
María, 51 years old, doesn't know how to read or write, because her mother decided not to send her to school so that she could help at home with the household chores.  She is partnered, and her partner works in agriculture, growing basic grains.  They have 3 children, who are adults and married.  In her house only two people reside, her husband and she. 

Maria takes care of the household tasks. Ever since she was young, she always worked in this job since her mother taught her how to do it and then she decided not to learn another job. Since she married, she had to take care of her husband and children.  She doesn't have a set schedule to do these jobs, since there are many chores during the day and there isn't a defined schedule.

The loan will be used for agriculture, for purchasing the agricultural package, manure, and insecticides, and to prepare the land.  She says that thanks to being granted the loan, she will be able to have better harvests and be able to have increased income to improve the quality of life for herself and her husband.

Maria, in the future, wants to have a better plot of land for her crops and to be able to have better and larger harvests, also she says that she wants to be able to have a farm with chickens to fatten that will generate more income for her husband and for her.  All this, she says, she will accomplish by saving a lot and investing it so that the dreams of her and her husband will become reality.

loans.use: to purchase the agriculture package, manure, insecticides, and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery and sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Friedrich Gotardo Kevit

texts.es:
Friedrich es un joven emprendedor, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Pisco junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente está estudiando una carrera profesional y también viene realizando sus prácticas en una prestigiosa empresa. Le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, estudiosa, trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación.
Friedrich está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un juego de sala para su casa, para que su familia pueda disfrutar de momentos agradables unidos. De esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para convertirse en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Friedrich is a young entrepreneur. He is 19 years old, single and lives in Pisco with his family. 

He is a person with great desire to come out ahead. He currently is studying a professional degree and is also carrying out his internship in a prestigious business. It is going very well for him because he is very responsible, studious, a hard worker, and wishes to improve. 

Friedrich is grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the support the have brought him he will be able to buy a sofa for his home, so that his family can enjoy pleasant moments together. In this way he will be improving his quality of life and will continue making an effort to become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a vegetable store in the market place

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de artesania, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia vende chompas, polos entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas de alpaca.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with her business of selling handmade items.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  The member sells her merchandise to her customers who request it.  She sells sweaters and polo style shirts, among other things.  She wishes to be able to continue working this way in order to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy alpaca sweaters.

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron, and concrete blocks and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an embroidery machine, a generator and fabric.

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia  Nicasia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERNADO LAS PALMERAS, la socia tiene 56 años de edad ,05 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna a sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos como quinua, trigo entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cebada entre otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner Nicasia belongs to the community bank Lidernado Las Palmeras. She is 56 years old, single, and with five children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling dried goods such as quinoa and wheat among others. She has spent a lot of time dedicating herself to this business, which is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts towards her business every day. 

Nicasia sells her merchandise to her customers that give her requests, and she wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of barley among other items for her business. 

The partner feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the fee payments.

loans.use: to buy barley among other goods for her business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia  Ana María pertenece al banco comunal LIDERNADO LAS PALMERAS, la socia tiene 42 años de edad ,02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna a sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solicitan como ami9stades.familaires ,amigos entre otros ,la socia vende chompas,casacas,pantalones entre otros, la socia a la vez trabaja para una institución privada, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a member of the communal bank LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS  She is 42 years old, a single mother of two children, and works daily at selling clothes,  among other activities.  She has been working at this for a long time, doing well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business.  She sells her merchandise to customers such as family, friends and others.   Ana Maria sells sweaters, jackets, pants and other clothing.  She also works for a private institution.  She wants to continue working this way to support her family.

Ana Maria is asking for this loan to buy jackets for her sales business.  She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy jackets for her sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine, sewing machine and generator.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of milk. Her business goal is to own a big enterprise within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will own a piece of land. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of milk
